examples.en: She understands that mistakes happen.
examples.zh: 她明白犯错是难免的。

definition.en: to have knowledge of how something works; to be familiar with a subject
definition.zh: 懂得（某领域/事物的原理）；熟悉某学科

examples.en: He understands math well.
examples.zh: 他数学学得很好。

examples.en: I don’t really understand computers.
examples.zh: 我其实不太懂电脑。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“understandan”看起来像是拼写错误，最可能是“understand”。
常见搭配：understand something（理解某事）；understand that + 句子（明白/意识到……）；understand why/how（理解原因/方式）。
易混：understand（理解、懂）≠ know（知道事实）≠ realize（意识到）。例如：I know the rule（我知道规则）；I understand the rule（我理解规则为什么这样、怎么用）。

summary.en: “Understanding” most commonly means comprehension or insight; it can also mean an informal agreement, or describe a person who is sympathetic and patient.
summary.zh: “understanding”最常指“理解”；也可指“（非正式的）共识/默契”；作形容词时表示“善解人意、体谅的”。

definition.en: knowledge or insight into the meaning of something; the ability to comprehend.
definition.zh: 理解；明白某事的意义或内涵的能力。

examples.en: Her understanding of the problem helped the whole team move forward.
examples.zh: 她对这个问题的理解帮助整个团队继续推进。

examples.en: I have a better understanding of what you mean now.
examples.zh: 我现在更明白你的意思了。

definition.en: an agreement, often informal, between people.
definition.zh: （常为非正式的）共识；默契；约定。

examples.en: We had an understanding that everyone would arrive on time.
examples.zh: 我们有个默契：大家都要准时到。

examples.en: They came to an understanding without signing a contract.
examples.zh: 他们没有签合同也达成了共识。

definition.en: sympathetic and patient; willing to consider other people’s feelings and situations.
definition.zh: 善解人意的；体谅的；有耐心的。

examples.en: He is very understanding when I make mistakes.
examples.zh: 我犯错时他很体谅。

examples.en: Try to be understanding with someone who is under a lot of stress.
examples.zh: 面对压力很大的人，尽量多一些体谅。

extraExplanation: 词形关系：understand（v. 理解）→ understanding（n. 理解；adj. 体谅的）。作为形容词时常用于描述“人”的态度：an understanding teacher（善解人意的老师）。
常见搭配：have/ gain/ develop an understanding of…（对……有/获得/形成理解）；reach/ come to an understanding（达成共识）；mutual understanding（相互理解）。

summary.en: “Understandments” is a rare/archaic (and often nonstandard) plural form meaning “understandings.” In modern English, use “understanding” or “understandings.”
summary.zh: “understandments”是罕见/古旧（且常被视为不标准）的复数形式，大致相当于“understandings”。现代英语通常用“understanding / understandings”。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) Understanding; the act or state of understanding; comprehension.
definition.zh: （罕见/古旧）理解；理解的行为或状态；领会。

examples.en: Through patient study, she gained a clearer understandment of the text.
examples.zh: 通过耐心学习，她对这篇文章有了更清晰的理解。

examples.en: His understandment of the rules improved over time.
examples.zh: 他对规则的理解随着时间而提高。

definition.en: (Rare/archaic) An opinion or agreement reached between people; an understanding.
definition.zh: （罕见/古旧）人与人之间达成的共识或约定；谅解。

examples.en: They came to an understandment about how to share the work.
examples.zh: 他们就如何分担工作达成了共识。

examples.en: There was an understandment that everyone would arrive on time.
examples.zh: 大家有个约定：所有人都要准时到。

extraExplanation:
“understandments”在现代英语里几乎不使用，常被视为不标准或拼写/用词错误。更自然的表达通常是：
- “understanding”表示“理解（不可数）”或“谅解/共识（可数）”
- “understandings”表示“多种理解/多项共识”
如果你想说“我对某事的理解”，常用：my understanding (of ...)；如果想说“我们达成共识”，常用：an understanding / an agreement。

summary.en: “Understands” means “(he/she/it) understands”: knows the meaning, grasps how something works, or empathizes with someone.
summary.zh: “understands”是“understand”的第三人称单数：表示（他/她/它）理解含义、明白原理，或体谅他人。

definition.en: Third-person singular present form of “understand”: to know what something means, how it works, or why it happens.
definition.zh: “understand”的第三人称单数现在时：理解某事的意思、运作方式或发生原因。

examples.en: She understands the instructions now.
examples.zh: 她现在理解这些说明了。

examples.en: He understands how the app works.
examples.zh: 他明白这个应用怎么运作。

definition.en: To realize someone’s feelings, situation, or point of view; to be sympathetic.
definition.zh: 体会并理解他人的感受、处境或观点；表示同理。

examples.en: My teacher understands how stressful exams can be.
examples.zh: 我的老师理解考试可能有多大压力。

examples.en: She understands what you’re going through.
examples.zh: 她理解你正在经历什么。

definition.en: To interpret spoken words correctly; to hear and comprehend.
definition.zh: 听懂（口头表达）；正确理解别人说的话。

examples.en: He understands English, but he doesn’t speak it much.
examples.zh: 他听得懂英语，但不太常说。

examples.en: Sorry—I don’t understand. Could you repeat that?
examples.zh: 抱歉，我没听懂。你能再说一遍吗？

extraExplanation: “understands”只用于一般现在时、主语是第三人称单数（he/she/it/单数名词）时：He understands. / The child understands.
常见搭配：understands that + 从句（理解……）；understands how/why/what（理解如何/为什么/什么）；understands + 人（理解某人、体谅某人）。
在口语里，“I understand.”常表示“我明白/我懂了”，也可表示礼貌的“我理解（你的处境）”。

summary.en: Understate means to describe something as less important, serious, or strong than it really is (to downplay).
summary.zh: Understate 指把事情说得没那么严重/重要/强烈，即“淡化、轻描淡写”。

definition.en: To describe something in a deliberately modest or less strong way than it really is; to downplay.
definition.zh: 用刻意谦虚或较弱的方式描述某事；淡化（事实、重要性或程度）。

examples.en: Calling the storm “a bit of bad weather” is understating the danger.
examples.zh: 把那场风暴说成“有点坏天气”是在淡化它的危险性。

examples.en: He understated his achievements in the interview.
examples.zh: 他在面试中淡化了自己的成就。

definition.en: To state something with less emphasis or intensity than it deserves, often for humor, politeness, or rhetorical effect.
definition.zh: 以较弱的语气表达本应更强烈的内容，常用于幽默、礼貌或修辞效果。

examples.en: “I’ve had a rough day” was an understatement after the flight cancellations and lost luggage.
examples.zh: 在航班取消、行李丢失之后，说“今天有点不顺”就成了轻描淡写。

examples.en: British speakers sometimes understate complaints to sound more polite.
examples.zh: 英国英语使用者有时会淡化抱怨，让语气更礼貌。

extraExplanation: “understate”常与名词“understatement（轻描淡写）”一起学习。常见固定说法：it’s an understatement（这简直是轻描淡写/远不止如此）。例如：“It’s an understatement to say I was surprised.”=“说我惊讶都算轻描淡写。”
与“overstate（夸大）”相对。语用上，understate 有时是一种委婉（politeness）或幽默（dry humor）的表达方式，尤其在英式表达中更常被提到。

summary.en: Understated describes something quiet, simple, and not attention-seeking, or an expression that downplays how strong/serious something is.
summary.zh: understated 指“低调不张扬、简洁克制”，也可指“轻描淡写、把程度说得比实际更轻”。

definition.en: Calm, simple, and not trying to attract attention; expressed in a quiet or modest way.
definition.zh: 低调的；朴素的；不张扬的；以平静或谦逊的方式表达的。

examples.en: She wore an understated black dress that looked elegant.
examples.zh: 她穿了一条低调的黑色连衣裙，看起来很优雅。

examples.en: His style is understated, but people notice the quality.
examples.zh: 他的风格很低调，但人们能注意到品质。

examples.en: The restaurant’s decor is understated and relaxing.
examples.zh: 这家餐厅的装潢朴素低调，让人放松。

definition.en: Not fully expressed or emphasized; presented as less important or less serious than it really is.
definition.zh: 轻描淡写的；表达得不充分的；把事情说得比实际更不重要/更不严重的。

examples.en: Calling the delay “inconvenient” is an understated way to describe the situation.
examples.zh: 把这次延误说成“有点不方便”是一种轻描淡写的说法。

examples.en: Her reaction was understated, even though she was upset.
examples.zh: 尽管她很难过，她的反应却很克制、很轻描淡写。

extraExplanation: “understated”常与审美和表达方式有关：在设计/穿搭里强调“简洁、有品味但不浮夸”；在语言里则接近“淡化语气”。它与修辞手法“understatement（低调陈述/弱化表达）”有关，常带有幽默或克制的效果。
常见搭配：understated elegance（低调的优雅）、understated luxury（低调奢华）、understated tone（克制的语气）。反义方向常见词：flashy / showy（张扬的）、overstated（夸大其词的）。

summary.en: “Understatement” means saying something in a way that makes it seem less serious or important than it really is, often for humor, politeness, or style.
summary.zh: “Understatement”指用轻描淡写的方式表达，让事情看起来没那么严重或重要，常用于幽默、礼貌或文体效果。

definition.en: A statement that makes something seem smaller, less important, or less serious than it really is (often for humor, politeness, or style).
definition.zh: 轻描淡写；把事情说得比实际更不严重/不重要的说法（常用于幽默、礼貌或文体效果）。

examples.en: Calling the storm “a bit of bad weather” was an understatement.
examples.zh: 把那场风暴说成“有点坏天气”就是轻描淡写。

examples.en: It’s an understatement to say the test was difficult.
examples.zh: 说这次考试很难，其实还是轻描淡写。

examples.en: When he said he was “not thrilled,” it was an understatement—he was furious.
examples.zh: 他说自己“不是很开心”，其实是轻描淡写——他非常生气。

definition.en: A literary/rhetorical technique in which a writer intentionally downplays something for emphasis or ironic effect.
definition.zh: （修辞/文学）低调陈述法：作者故意淡化表达，以产生强调或反讽效果。

examples.en: In many British comedies, understatement is used to make a situation funnier.
examples.zh: 在很多英式喜剧中，轻描淡写常用来让情境更好笑。

examples.en: The narrator’s understatement highlights how extreme the event really was.
examples.zh: 叙述者的轻描淡写反而凸显了事件的极端程度。

extraExplanation: “Understatement”常见对比词是“exaggeration（夸张）”。它在英式英语文化里尤其常见：面对尴尬或糟糕的事，人们用更平淡的措辞来保持克制、礼貌或制造幽默。
常见搭配：an understatement / a huge understatement（非常轻描淡写）/ classic understatement（典型的轻描淡写）。常见句型：It’s an understatement to say…（说……其实还是轻描淡写）。

summary.en: “Understood” most commonly means “comprehended,” and it can also mean “accepted/assumed without being said.”
summary.zh: “Understood” 最常见表示“理解了”，也可表示“不言而喻/默认接受的”。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “understand”; to have comprehended the meaning of something.
definition.zh: “understand”的过去式和过去分词；理解、明白某事的含义。

examples.en: I understood the lesson after the teacher explained it again.
examples.zh: 老师又解释了一遍后，我就明白这节课了。

examples.en: She finally understood what he meant.
examples.zh: 她终于明白他是什么意思了。

definition.en: accepted or assumed without being stated directly; mutually agreed or taken for granted.
definition.zh: 不必明说而被接受/默认的；心照不宣的；约定俗成的。

examples.en: It’s understood that phones should be on silent during the movie.
examples.zh: 大家都默认看电影时手机应调成静音。

examples.en: There was an understood rule: don’t interrupt when someone is speaking.
examples.zh: 有条不成文的规矩：别人说话时不要打断。

extraExplanation: “It is understood that …” 常用于正式或书面语，意思是“大家都认为/默认/约定 …”，强调这件事不一定写在规则里，但普遍被接受。
口语里单独说“Understood.” 常作为回应，表示“明白了/收到”，语气比 “OK” 更正式一点，也常见于工作、军警、客服沟通中。

summary.en: An understudy is a backup performer who can replace the main actor; it can also mean to train as someone’s backup.
summary.zh: understudy 指能顶替主角的替补演员；也可作动词，指作为某人的候补进行学习准备。

definition.en: A performer who learns a role so they can replace the main actor if needed (especially in theater).
definition.zh: （尤指戏剧中）替补演员；候补演员（学习某个角色，以便主角无法上场时顶替）。

examples.en: She is the understudy for the lead role.
examples.zh: 她是主角的替补演员。

examples.en: If the actor gets sick, the understudy will go on stage.
examples.zh: 如果演员生病了，替补演员就会上台。

definition.en: To serve as an understudy; to learn and be ready to take someone’s place in a performance or job.
definition.zh: 担任替补；作为候补学习并随时准备顶替（演出角色或工作岗位）。

examples.en: He understudied the role for weeks before opening night.
examples.zh: 在首演之夜前，他为这个角色当了好几周的替补并学习准备。

examples.en: She understudied her manager to learn the job.
examples.zh: 她作为经理的候补跟岗学习这份工作。

extraExplanation: “understudy”最常见于戏剧/音乐剧语境：替补演员通常要像正式演员一样熟悉台词、走位、服装与舞台调度，但不一定每晚都上场。
在职场里也可引申使用，表示“接班人/候补人选”在旁学习（类似跟岗、培养接任）。

summary.en: “undert” is not a standard English word; it’s usually a typo or an incomplete form of another word.
summary.zh: “undert”不是标准英语单词；通常是拼写错误或未输入完整的其他单词。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it is most often a misspelling or incomplete typing of words like “under,” “undertake,” or “undertone.”
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；最常见是“under（在……下面/低于）”“undertake（承担/着手）”或“undertone（潜台词/低声）”等词的拼写错误或未打完。

examples.en: I typed “undert” by mistake—I meant “under.”
examples.zh: 我把“undert”打错了——我想写的是“under”。

examples.en: Did you mean “undertake” (to begin or accept responsibility for something)?
examples.zh: 你是不是想写“undertake”（开始做某事或承担责任）？

extraExplanation:
“undert”本身在现代英语里不作为常用词条出现。学习时建议先确认你想表达的意思：
- 想表示“在……下面/低于”：用 under（如 under the table 在桌子下面）。
- 想表示“承担/着手做”：用 undertake（如 undertake a project 承接/开展一个项目）。
- 想表示“潜在含义/弦外之音”：用 undertone（如 an undertone of sadness 带着一丝忧伤的意味）。
如果你把原句发我，我可以帮你确定最合适的词。

summary.en: Undertake means to take on responsibility for a task, or to begin doing something important or challenging.
summary.zh: Undertake 指“承担责任/接下任务”或“着手做重要或有挑战的事”。

definition.en: to agree to do a task or take responsibility for something, especially something difficult or important
definition.zh: 承担；答应去做（尤指困难或重要的任务）；负责

examples.en: She undertook the project knowing it would take months.
examples.zh: 她明知这个项目要花好几个月，仍然承担了下来。

examples.en: The company undertook to repair the damage within two weeks.
examples.zh: 公司承诺在两周内修复损坏。

definition.en: to begin and try to do something (a task, journey, or plan)
definition.zh: 着手进行；开始尝试做（某项任务/旅程/计划）

examples.en: They undertook a long journey across the desert.
examples.zh: 他们开始了一段穿越沙漠的长途旅程。

examples.en: He undertook an investigation into the cause of the accident.
examples.zh: 他着手调查事故原因。

extraExplanation: “undertake”常见于正式语境（工作、法律、公告等）。常用结构：undertake to do sth（承诺/答应去做）；undertake sth（承担/着手某事）。
词源上含有“take（拿起）”的感觉：把某个责任或任务“接过来”。因此它比“do”更强调责任与分量。

summary.en: “Undertaken” is the past participle of “undertake,” meaning to begin, commit to, or take responsibility for something.
summary.zh: “undertaken”是“undertake”的过去分词，表示开始做、承诺去做，或承担某事的责任。

definition.en: past participle of “undertake”: started or agreed to do something (often something difficult or important).
definition.zh: “undertake”的过去分词：开始做或答应去做某事（通常是困难或重要的事）。

examples.en: She has undertaken a new research project.
examples.zh: 她已经开始了一项新的研究项目。

examples.en: The company had undertaken to deliver the order by Friday.
examples.zh: 公司已承诺在周五前交付订单。

definition.en: past participle of “undertake”: accepted responsibility for a task, duty, or role.
definition.zh: “undertake”的过去分词：承担（任务、责任或角色）。

examples.en: The work was undertaken by a team of volunteers.
examples.zh: 这项工作由一组志愿者承担。

examples.en: He undertook the care of his younger sister while their parents worked.
examples.zh: 父母工作时，他承担起照顾妹妹的责任。

extraExplanation: “undertaken”常用于完成时（has/have/had undertaken）或被动语态（was undertaken）。写作中常见搭配：undertake a project/study/investigation（开展项目/研究/调查），undertake responsibility/tasks（承担责任/任务），undertake to do sth（答应做某事）。

summary.en: An undertaker is usually a funeral worker who arranges funerals and cares for the dead; more rarely, it can mean someone who takes on a task.
summary.zh: undertaker通常指殡仪员/殡葬承办人；较少见的意思是“承担某项任务的人”。

definition.en: A person whose job is to arrange funerals and take care of a dead person’s body (for example, preparing the body and organizing burial or cremation).
definition.zh: 殡葬业者；殡仪员（负责安排葬礼并处理遗体，如整容、防腐、安葬或火化等）。

examples.en: The undertaker helped the family plan a simple funeral.
examples.zh: 殡仪员帮助家人安排了一场简朴的葬礼。

examples.en: In many small towns, the undertaker is also the funeral director.
examples.zh: 在许多小镇，殡仪员也常兼任葬礼主持/殡葬承办人。

definition.en: Someone or something that undertakes (takes on) a particular task or responsibility.
definition.zh: 承担者；承办者（指承担某项任务或责任的人/事物）。

examples.en: The company became the undertaker of the new bridge project.
examples.zh: 这家公司成了新桥项目的承建方。

examples.en: History often remembers him as the undertaker of major reforms.
examples.zh: 历史常把他视为重大改革的推动/承担者。

extraExplanation: “undertaker”源自动词undertake（承担、着手做）。在现代英语中最常用的是“殡仪员/殡葬承办人”的意思；第二个“承担者”较书面、较少见。
在英国英语里，undertaker有时可更广泛指“殡葬承办商”；在美式英语中更常听到funeral director（葬礼承办人）或mortician（殡仪员/遗体处理人员）。
在文学与影视中，undertaker常带有阴郁、庄重的氛围，用来强化死亡、仪式感或小镇人情社会的描写。

summary.en: “undertakes” means “starts or takes responsibility for a task,” often in a formal tone.
summary.zh: “undertakes”表示“着手做某事/承担某项责任”，语气较正式。

definition.en: (3rd person singular of “undertake”) to start doing a task or project, especially one that needs effort, skill, or planning.
definition.zh: （undertake 的第三人称单数）着手做；承担开展（通常指需要努力、技能或计划的任务/项目）。

examples.en: She undertakes a new research project every summer.
examples.zh: 她每年夏天都会着手一个新的研究项目。

examples.en: The company undertakes repairs within 24 hours.
examples.zh: 公司承诺在24小时内进行维修。

definition.en: to accept responsibility for something; to take on a duty or role.
definition.zh: 承担责任；接手职责或角色。

examples.en: He undertakes full responsibility for the team’s safety.
examples.zh: 他承担团队安全的全部责任。

examples.en: Our clinic undertakes the care of elderly patients.
examples.zh: 我们诊所负责照护老年患者。

definition.en: to formally promise or agree to do something (often in legal or official contexts).
definition.zh: （常用于法律或正式语境）正式承诺；保证去做某事。

examples.en: The tenant undertakes to pay the rent on time.
examples.zh: 租户承诺按时支付房租。

examples.en: They undertake not to share confidential information.
examples.zh: 他们承诺不泄露机密信息。

extraExplanation: “undertake(s)”常见于较正式的书面英语（合同、公告、学术写作）。日常口语里更常用：take on / start / commit to。
注意不要和“undertaker”（殡葬业者）混淆；两者词形相近但含义完全不同。

summary.en: Undertaking most often means a serious task or project; it can also mean a formal commitment, and (in BrE) the funeral business.
summary.zh: Undertaking最常指一项重要的任务或项目；也可指正式承诺；在英式英语中还可指殡葬业。

definition.en: A task, project, or responsibility that you agree to do, often something serious or difficult.
definition.zh: 承担的任务／项目／责任（通常较重要或较困难）。

examples.en: Starting a new business is a major undertaking.
examples.zh: 创办一家新公司是一项重大的事业。

examples.en: The charity took on the undertaking of building a school.
examples.zh: 该慈善机构承担了建一所学校的任务。

definition.en: A formal promise, commitment, or guarantee to do something.
definition.zh: （正式的）承诺／保证／约定去做某事。

examples.en: The contractor gave a written undertaking to finish the work by June.
examples.zh: 承包商出具了书面承诺，保证在六月前完工。

examples.en: She signed an undertaking not to share the confidential information.
examples.zh: 她签署了承诺书，保证不泄露机密信息。

definition.en: In British English, the business or profession of arranging funerals.
definition.zh: （英式英语）殡葬业；承办葬礼的行业。

examples.en: He worked in undertaking for many years before retiring.
examples.zh: 他在殡葬行业工作多年后退休。

extraExplanation: “Undertaking”来自动词“undertake”（承担、着手）。作为名词时，常见搭配有：a major/huge undertaking（重大任务）、an undertaking to do sth（做某事的正式承诺）。
在法律或正式文件语境中，“undertaking”通常指具有约束力的书面承诺（类似“保证书/承诺书”），语气比普通的“promise”更正式。

summary.en: Undertone is a subtle, less obvious feeling, meaning, sound, or color that exists underneath the main one.
summary.zh: Undertone 指隐藏在表面之下的细微情绪、含义、副音或底色。

definition.en: a subtle or hidden quality in something (such as a feeling, meaning, or attitude) that is not stated directly
definition.zh: （情绪、含义、态度等）潜在的、未明说的暗示；弦外之音

examples.en: There was an undertone of anger in his voice, even though he smiled.
examples.zh: 尽管他在笑，但他的声音里带着一丝怒意。

examples.en: The article has an undertone of criticism toward the government.
examples.zh: 这篇文章对政府带有隐隐的批评意味。

definition.en: a secondary, quieter sound that is heard along with a main sound
definition.zh: （与主音同时出现的）较轻的副音；潜音

examples.en: Beneath the melody, you can hear an undertone of low drums.
examples.zh: 在旋律之下，你能听到低鼓声的副音。

definition.en: a subtle hue under the surface color, especially in skin, hair, or paint
definition.zh: （尤指肤色、发色或颜料的）底色；隐约的色调

examples.en: This foundation suits people with warm undertones.
examples.zh: 这款粉底适合暖底色的人。

examples.en: The blue has a gray undertone.
examples.zh: 这种蓝色带一点灰调的底色。

extraExplanation: undertone 常用来描述“说话或文字背后”的情绪与立场，和 overtone（明显的暗示/附加意味）相对：undertone 更“隐”、更不容易被直接指出。
在肤色/美妆语境里，undertone 指皮肤“偏暖/偏冷/偏中性”的底色（不等同于表面深浅）。常见搭配：warm/cool/neutral undertone。

summary.en: “Undertook” is the past tense of “undertake”: it means you accepted responsibility for something or started an important task.
summary.zh: “undertook”是“undertake”的过去式，表示承担责任/答应去做某事，或着手开展一项重要任务。

definition.en: past tense of “undertake”: to agree to do something (often difficult) or to take responsibility for it
definition.zh: “undertake”的过去式：承担（通常较困难的）任务；答应去做并负责

examples.en: She undertook a new project at work and led the team for six months.
examples.zh: 她在工作中承担了一个新项目，并带领团队持续了六个月。

examples.en: The company undertook to repair the damage within two weeks.
examples.zh: 公司承诺在两周内修复损坏。

examples.en: He undertook the mission even though it was risky.
examples.zh: 尽管有风险，他还是承担了这项任务。

definition.en: past tense of “undertake”: to start or attempt a task, journey, or plan
definition.zh: “undertake”的过去式：着手进行；尝试开展（任务、旅程或计划）

examples.en: They undertook a long journey across the country.
examples.zh: 他们开始了一段横跨全国的长途旅行。

examples.en: Researchers undertook a study to understand the disease better.
examples.zh: 研究人员开展了一项研究，以更好地了解这种疾病。

extraExplanation: “undertake”是不规则动词：undertake → undertook → undertaken。常见搭配：undertake a project/task/study（承担/开展项目/任务/研究）；undertake to do sth（答应/承诺做某事）。语气通常较正式，常用于工作、学术或官方场合。

summary.en: Undertreatment means not getting enough or appropriate treatment for a health problem.
summary.zh: Undertreatment 指对健康问题的治疗不够或不合适，导致疗效不足。

definition.en: inadequate medical care or therapy; not giving enough treatment for a condition.
definition.zh: 治疗不足；对某种疾病或状况给的治疗不够、不到位。

examples.en: The doctor worried that the patient’s pain was due to undertreatment.
examples.zh: 医生担心病人的疼痛是因为治疗不足。

examples.en: Undertreatment of depression can make symptoms last longer.
examples.zh: 抑郁症治疗不足会让症状持续更久。

examples.en: Some communities face undertreatment because of limited access to healthcare.
examples.zh: 一些社区因医疗资源有限而面临治疗不足。

extraExplanation: 这个词常见于医学与公共卫生讨论，尤其是“疼痛管理（pain management）”“心理健康（mental health）”等领域。它既可能指剂量/疗程不够，也可能指根本没有使用合适的治疗方法。
构词法：under-（不足、不够）+ treatment（治疗）。常见对照词：overtreatment（过度治疗）。

summary.en: Underuse means to use something less than you should/could; underused describes something not fully or efficiently used.
summary.zh: underuse 指“未充分使用”；underused 指“使用不足、未充分利用的”。

definition.en: to use something less than you should or less than it could be used
definition.zh: 未充分使用；使用不足（低于应有或可达到的程度）

examples.en: The classroom is underused because most classes are online now.
examples.zh: 这间教室没有被充分利用，因为现在大多数课程都在线上。

examples.en: We’re underusing our team’s skills by giving them only simple tasks.
examples.zh: 我们只让团队做简单任务，这是在低估并未充分利用他们的技能。

definition.en: used less than is normal, expected, or efficient
definition.zh: 使用不足的；未充分利用的

examples.en: Many underused parks could become safer with better lighting.
examples.zh: 许多利用不足的公园如果有更好的照明会更安全。

examples.en: The city wants to develop underused land near the train station.
examples.zh: 这座城市想开发火车站附近未充分利用的土地。

synonyms: fail to make full use of
extraExplanation: “under-”这个前缀表示“不足、低于……程度”。所以 underuse = under（不足）+ use（使用）。常见同类词：underpay（少付工资）、underestimate（低估）、underfund（资金不足）。
在商业/公共政策语境里，underused 常用来描述“资源没被有效利用”，例如 underused space（闲置空间）、underused capacity（产能未用足）、underused assets（未充分利用的资产）。

summary.en: Underused means not used enough or used less than expected, especially for resources, space, or people’s abilities.
summary.zh: underused 指“未被充分使用/利用率低”，常形容资源、空间或才能没有被好好利用。

definition.en: Not used enough; used less often than it should be.
definition.zh: 未被充分使用的；用得不够多的。

examples.en: This room is underused and could become a study area.
examples.zh: 这个房间没被充分利用，可以改成一个学习区。

examples.en: Many public parks are underused in winter.
examples.zh: 很多公共公园在冬天利用率很低。

definition.en: Used less than other options or less than expected (often about resources, skills, or opportunities).
definition.zh: （资源、技能或机会等）使用率低于其他选择或低于预期的。

examples.en: Her talents were underused at her old job.
examples.zh: 她的才能在以前的工作里没有得到充分发挥。

examples.en: The bus line is underused compared with the subway.
examples.zh: 这条公交线路相比地铁使用的人更少。

extraExplanation: “under-”表示“不足/低于”，常见于underpaid（薪资偏低）、underrated（被低估）、underdeveloped（欠发达）等词。
underused 常用于描述“空间、设备、预算、时间、人才”等没有被好好利用的情况；语气通常比较中性，也可带一点“可惜/有改进空间”的含义。

summary.en: Underutilized means something is not being used enough or to its full potential.
summary.zh: underutilized表示某物没有被充分使用或没有发挥出应有的价值。

definition.en: Not used enough, or not used to its full potential.
definition.zh: 未被充分利用的；使用不足的；没有发挥出应有作用的。

examples.en: The library is an underutilized resource in our community.
examples.zh: 图书馆是我们社区里一个未被充分利用的资源。

examples.en: Many talented employees feel underutilized in routine jobs.
examples.zh: 许多有才华的员工在重复性工作中感到没有被充分发挥。

examples.en: The building’s underutilized space could become a study area.
examples.zh: 这栋楼里未被充分利用的空间可以改造成自习区。

extraExplanation: “under-”表示“不足、低于应有程度”，因此underutilized直观含义就是“利用得不够”。常用于商业、教育、公共资源等语境，带有“明明有价值却没被好好用”的语气。
常见搭配：underutilized resources（未充分利用的资源）、underutilized capacity（产能/容量利用不足）、underutilized talent（人才未被充分发挥）。
易混词：underused更口语、更常见；underutilized更偏正式、书面或职场表达。

summary.en: Undervaluation means valuing something below its real or fair worth, often used in finance (stocks, assets, currency) and in social contexts (work or contributions being undervalued).
summary.zh: Undervaluation 指把某事物的价值估得低于其真实或合理水平，常用于金融（股票、资产、货币）以及社会语境（某类工作或贡献被低估）。

definition.en: the act of valuing something too low; the state of being valued too low
definition.zh: （对某物）估价过低；低估（的行为或状态）

examples.en: The undervaluation of the company’s shares attracted investors.
examples.zh: 这家公司股票被低估，吸引了投资者。

examples.en: She spoke about the undervaluation of care work in society.
examples.zh: 她谈到了社会对照护劳动价值的低估。

definition.en: in finance and economics, the setting of a price, currency value, or asset value below its true or fair value
definition.zh: （金融/经济）把价格、汇率或资产价值定得低于其真实或合理价值；低估定价/低估汇率

examples.en: Some critics argued that the currency’s undervaluation made exports cheaper.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为该货币被低估使出口更便宜。

examples.en: Undervaluation can distort trade and investment decisions.
examples.zh: 低估可能会扭曲贸易和投资决策。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：under-（低于/不足）+ valuation（估价/评价）→ undervaluation（低估）。常见于商业、金融（股票、资产、货币）以及社会议题（某类工作、群体贡献被低估）。
易混词：undervaluation（名词）强调“低估”这一事实/现象；undervalue（动词）表示“低估某物”；underestimate 更常用于“低估数量/难度/风险”等，不一定与“价值/价格”直接相关。

summary.en: “Undervalue” means to underestimate the worth, importance, or price of something or someone.
summary.zh: “undervalue”指低估某人/某物的价值、重要性或价格。

definition.en: to think something is worth less than it really is; to not appreciate its true value or importance
definition.zh: 低估；小看；认为某事物的价值或重要性比实际更低

examples.en: Don’t undervalue your experience—you’ve learned a lot from this job.
examples.zh: 别低估你的经验——你从这份工作中学到了很多。

examples.en: The market initially undervalued the company, but its stock later rose.
examples.zh: 市场起初低估了这家公司，但它的股价后来上涨了。

definition.en: to set a price or estimate that is too low
definition.zh: 把（价格/估价）定得过低；低估价

examples.en: We undervalued the house and sold it for less than it was worth.
examples.zh: 我们把房子估价过低，卖价低于它的真实价值。

examples.en: She worried the contractor had undervalued the cost of repairs.
examples.zh: 她担心承包商低估了维修费用。

extraExplanation: “under-”表示“在……之下/不足”，加在词前常表示“低于应有水平”（如 underestimate 低估、underpay 少付薪水）。
“undervalue”既可指“心理/社会层面的小看、不重视”（undervalue people’s work），也可指“金钱层面的估价过低”（undervalue a house）。语境不同，侧重点不同。
常见搭配：undervalue oneself（妄自菲薄/低估自己）、be undervalued（被低估/被低看）、undervalued asset（被低估的资产）。

summary.en: “Undervalued” means someone or something is judged as less valuable than it truly is—either emotionally (not appreciated) or financially (priced too low).
summary.zh: “undervalued”指某人或某物的价值被看低：既可以是情感/职场层面的“不被重视”，也可以是金融/价格层面的“估值过低”。

definition.en: not considered to be as valuable, important, or good as it really is; underrated
definition.zh: 被低估的；未得到应有重视/认可的；价值被看低的

examples.en: Teachers are often undervalued despite their impact on society.
examples.zh: 教师尽管对社会影响巨大，却常常被低估。

examples.en: She felt undervalued at work because her ideas were rarely credited.
examples.zh: 她在工作中觉得自己被低估了，因为她的想法很少被认可。

definition.en: priced or valued too low compared with what something is really worth (often in finance or shopping)
definition.zh: （价格/估值）偏低的；低于其真实价值的（常用于金融或购物语境）

examples.en: Many investors believe the stock is undervalued and may rise later.
examples.zh: 许多投资者认为这只股票被低估了，之后可能会上涨。

examples.en: This house seems undervalued for the neighborhood.
examples.zh: 以这个社区的行情来看，这套房子似乎定价偏低。

extraExplanation: undervalued = under-（不足/低于）+ valued（被评价/被重视）。既可指“价格低估”，也可指“人的贡献未被认可”。日常表达中常用于职场与人际关系：feel undervalued（觉得不被重视）。
常见对比：undervalued（被低估/不被重视）侧重“外界给的价值太低”；unappreciated（不被感激/不被感谢）更强调“缺少感谢与认可的情感层面”。

summary.en: “Undervaluing” means not giving enough value, importance, or credit to someone or something.
summary.zh: “Undervaluing”指对某人或某事的价值、重要性或贡献估计不足（轻视、低估）。

definition.en: the act of thinking something is less valuable, less important, or less skilled than it really is; not giving it enough credit
definition.zh: 低估；轻视：认为某事物的价值、重要性或能力比实际更低；没有给予足够的认可

examples.en: Undervaluing your own work can make it harder to ask for fair pay.
examples.zh: 低估自己的工作，会让你更难争取到合理的报酬。

examples.en: The company’s undervaluing of customer support hurt its reputation.
examples.zh: 公司对客服支持的轻视损害了它的声誉。

definition.en: treating something as worth less than it truly is; not appreciating it enough
definition.zh: 低估的；被低估地对待的：把某事物看得不如实际重要或有价值；不够重视

examples.en: She was tired of the undervaluing comments about her accent.
examples.zh: 她厌倦了那些轻视她口音的评论。

examples.en: Undervaluing small daily habits can stop you from making real progress.
examples.zh: 低估日常小习惯的重要性，会阻碍你取得真正的进步。

extraExplanation: “Undervaluing”来自动词“undervalue”（under- 表示“不足/低于” + value “价值/重视”）。在职场语境里很常见：undervaluing someone’s contribution（低估某人的贡献）可能涉及不公平的评价或薪酬。
常见搭配：undervaluing yourself（低估自己）、undervaluing the importance of…（低估……的重要性）、feel undervalued（感觉不被重视）。注意：undervalued 更常用来形容“被低估的”，而 undervaluing 更强调“正在低估/轻视的行为或态度”。

summary.en: “Underwater” means under the surface of water (adjective/adverb) and can also refer to the underwater environment (noun).
summary.zh: “underwater”表示“在水下的/在水下”，也可指“水下环境/水下世界”。

definition.en: Located, happening, or used under the surface of water.
definition.zh: 在水面下的；发生在水下的；用于水下的。

examples.en: Many colorful fish live underwater near the coral reef.
examples.zh: 许多色彩斑斓的鱼生活在珊瑚礁附近的水下。

examples.en: The team did underwater filming for the documentary.
examples.zh: 团队为纪录片进行了水下拍摄。

examples.en: Underwater volcanoes can create new islands over time.
examples.zh: 水下火山随着时间推移可能形成新的岛屿。

definition.en: In or into the water, below the surface.
definition.zh: 在水下；到水下。

examples.en: Hold your breath and go underwater for a few seconds.
examples.zh: 屏住呼吸，在水下待几秒钟。

examples.en: She looked underwater and found her ring.
examples.zh: 她在水下寻找，找到了戒指。

definition.en: The underwater world or environment.
definition.zh: 水下环境；水下世界（统称）。

examples.en: The photographer studies underwater and its changing light.
examples.zh: 这位摄影师研究水下世界及其变化的光线。

examples.en: Pollution harms underwater in ways we don’t always see.
examples.zh: 污染对水下环境的伤害，我们并不总能看见。

extraExplanation: “under-”表示“在……之下”，“water”是“水”。组合成underwater，常用于自然、运动（潜水/游泳）、科技（潜艇、声呐）等语境。
常见搭配：underwater camera（水下相机）、underwater diving（潜水）、underwater noise（水下噪声）、underwater cable（海底/水下电缆）、underwater archaeology（水下考古）。

summary.en: Underway means something has already started and is in progress; it can also mean a ship is moving.
summary.zh: Underway 指事情已经开始并在进行中；也可指船只正在航行。

definition.en: Already started and currently in progress.
definition.zh: 已经开始并正在进行中。

examples.en: The project is underway, so changes will be harder to make now.
examples.zh: 项目已经在进行中，所以现在更改会更难。

examples.en: An investigation is underway after the accident.
examples.zh: 事故发生后，调查正在进行中。

definition.en: In motion; moving forward, especially of a ship or boat.
definition.zh: （尤指船只）在航行中；在移动前进。

examples.en: The ship is underway and will reach the island by morning.
examples.zh: 船正在航行，预计早上到达岛上。

examples.en: Once the boat was underway, the wind felt much stronger.
examples.zh: 船一旦航行起来，风感觉更强了。

definition.en: Currently happening or developing (often used after the noun: “plans underway”).
definition.zh: 正在发生或推进中（常放在名词后：如 plans underway）。

examples.en: Talks are underway to reduce costs.
examples.zh: 为了降低成本，会谈正在进行中。

examples.en: With repairs underway, the road will be closed this weekend.
examples.zh: 由于维修正在进行，这条路本周末将关闭。

extraExplanation: “underway”常见于新闻与正式写作，尤其是“be underway”或“are underway”结构（如：The trial is underway）。口语里也可用“in progress / going on / happening”。
在航海语境里，“underway”是专业用法，表示船只不再系泊或抛锚，已开始移动（区别于 at anchor / moored）。

summary.en: Underwear means clothing worn under other clothes, next to the skin.
summary.zh: Underwear 指穿在外衣里面、贴身的内衣。

definition.en: Clothing worn next to the skin under other clothes, covering the private parts; items like briefs, boxers, bras, and undershirts.
definition.zh: 内衣；贴身穿在外衣里面的衣物，用来遮盖私密部位，如内裤、四角裤、胸罩、背心等。

examples.en: Pack enough underwear for the trip.
examples.zh: 旅行要带够内衣。

examples.en: He changed into clean underwear after his workout.
examples.zh: 运动后他换上了干净的内衣。

examples.en: This brand makes comfortable, breathable underwear.
examples.zh: 这个牌子的内衣穿起来舒适又透气。

extraExplanation: “Underwear”通常是不可数名词（some underwear），但在口语里也有人把它当作可数来用（two underwears），不过较不正式。更自然的说法是：two pairs of underwear / two pairs of briefs。
日常更具体的词：men’s underwear（男士内裤/贴身内衣）、women’s underwear 或 lingerie（女士内衣，lingerie 更偏“精致/性感”的内衣）。
在某些语境里可用更委婉的说法：underclothes（较书面）或 intimates（商品分类用语）。

summary.en: “Underwent” is the past tense of “undergo,” meaning to experience a process/change or to receive medical treatment/surgery.
summary.zh: “underwent”是“undergo”的过去式，表示“经历某个过程/变化”或“接受治疗/手术”。

definition.en: to experience something (often a process, change, or difficult event)
definition.zh: 经历；经受（常指一个过程、变化或艰难事件）

examples.en: She underwent a major change after moving to a new city.
examples.zh: 搬到新城市后，她经历了很大的变化。

examples.en: The company underwent restructuring last year.
examples.zh: 这家公司去年经历了重组。

definition.en: to have a medical operation or treatment
definition.zh: 接受（手术或治疗）

examples.en: He underwent surgery on his knee.
examples.zh: 他接受了膝盖手术。

examples.en: Patients may undergo chemotherapy for several months.
examples.zh: 病人可能需要接受几个月的化疗。

extraExplanation: “underwent”是动词“undergo”的过去式，语气比较正式，常用于新闻、学术或书面表达。日常口语里也可以用“go through”“have（an operation）”来表达类似意思，例如：He went through a tough time. / He had knee surgery.
常见搭配：undergo surgery / treatment / testing（接受手术/治疗/检测）；undergo changes / transformation / reform（经历变化/转型/改革）；undergo training（接受训练）。

summary.en: “Underwhelm” means something is less impressive or exciting than you expected.
summary.zh: “Underwhelm”表示某事物不如预期精彩，给人的感觉是平淡、没那么惊艳。

definition.en: To fail to impress or excite someone; to make someone feel less interested than expected.
definition.zh: 未能给人留下深刻印象；不如预期那么令人兴奋或满意。

examples.en: The movie trailer looked amazing, but the film itself underwhelmed me.
examples.zh: 预告片看起来很精彩，但电影本身让我有点失望。

examples.en: Her presentation was clear, but it underwhelmed the audience because it had no new ideas.
examples.zh: 她的演讲很清晰，但因为缺乏新观点，观众觉得不够惊艳。

extraExplanation: “Underwhelm”常用来表达“期待很高，但实际体验平平甚至失望”。语气通常比“disappoint”更轻一点，带有“没那么糟，但不够好”的感觉。
它有点像“overwhelm（让人震撼/应接不暇）”的反义表达：overwhelm是超出预期地强烈，underwhelm是低于预期地平淡。
常见搭配：underwhelm someone（让某人不够满意/不够惊艳），be underwhelmed by something（对某事感到不够惊艳）。

summary.en: Underworld can mean the mythic land of the dead, or the secret/illegal world of crime, and by extension any dark hidden realm.
summary.zh: underworld 可指神话中的冥界，也可指黑社会/地下犯罪世界，并可引申为任何阴暗隐秘的领域。

definition.en: (Mythology) The realm of the dead; a place where souls go after death (often imagined underground).
definition.zh: （神话）冥界；亡者的世界；死后灵魂去的地方（常被想象在地下）。

examples.en: In Greek mythology, Hades rules the underworld.
examples.zh: 在希腊神话中，哈迪斯统治冥界。

examples.en: The hero descends into the underworld to seek the truth.
examples.zh: 英雄下到冥界去寻找真相。

definition.en: The world of secret or illegal activities, especially organized crime.
definition.zh: （尤指有组织犯罪的）黑社会；地下犯罪世界。

examples.en: The movie shows the underworld of the city: gangs, bribery, and fear.
examples.zh: 这部电影展现了城市的黑社会：帮派、贿赂与恐惧。

examples.en: Police tried to break the underworld’s control of the docks.
examples.zh: 警方试图打破黑社会对码头的控制。

definition.en: A hidden, dark, or unknown part of society or human experience.
definition.zh: （比喻）社会或人性中隐秘、阴暗或不为人知的一面。

examples.en: The book explores the underworld of online scams.
examples.zh: 这本书探讨了网络骗局的阴暗世界。

examples.en: He felt drawn into an underworld of doubt and obsession.
examples.zh: 他感觉自己被拉进了怀疑与执念的阴暗深处。

extraExplanation: “underworld”由 under（在……下面）+ world（世界）构成。神话意义上常写作 the Underworld（首字母大写），指“冥界”这一特定概念；而表示犯罪世界时通常不大写。
文学与影视中常用“descend into the underworld（下到冥界/堕入黑暗世界）”作为母题，既可指真实的神话旅行（如奥菲斯寻妻的故事），也常作为进入危险、隐秘领域的隐喻。

summary.en: Underwrite means to take on financial risk—most often by providing insurance coverage or guaranteeing/funding a financial deal.
summary.zh: underwrite 指承担财务风险，最常见是“承保”（保险）或“承销/担保”（金融交易）。

definition.en: (Insurance/finance) To agree to take financial responsibility for possible loss, especially by providing insurance coverage.
definition.zh: （保险/金融）承保；同意承担可能损失的财务风险，尤其指提供保险保障。

examples.en: This policy is underwritten by a major international insurer.
examples.zh: 这份保单由一家大型国际保险公司承保。

examples.en: Some insurers refused to underwrite homes in high-risk wildfire areas.
examples.zh: 一些保险公司拒绝为高野火风险地区的房屋承保。

definition.en: (Business/finance) To guarantee or fund a financial deal, such as a loan or a new stock offering, often by agreeing to buy what others don’t.
definition.zh: （商业/金融）为融资交易提供担保或资金支持（如贷款、股票发行）；常指承诺把市场上未售出的部分买下来。

examples.en: The bank agreed to underwrite the company’s bond issue.
examples.zh: 这家银行同意为该公司的债券发行提供承销/担保。

examples.en: Investors were more confident because the IPO was underwritten by a well-known firm.
examples.zh: 因为这次首次公开募股由知名机构承销，投资者更有信心。

definition.en: (Publishing, less common) To write something at the end of a document; to sign or add a note beneath text.
definition.zh: （出版/较少见）在文末书写；在文字下方签名或补注。

examples.en: In older usage, an editor might underwrite a short note beneath the main text.
examples.zh: 在较早的用法中，编辑可能会在正文下方加写一段短注。

extraExplanation: 词源上，underwrite 原意是“写在下面”。早期商贸/海上保险中，承保人会把名字写在保单或合同下方，表示愿意承担风险；因此逐渐发展出“承保/承销/担保”的金融含义。
常见搭配：underwrite a policy（承保保单）、underwrite a loan（为贷款提供担保/支持）、underwrite an IPO/bond issue（承销首次公开募股/债券发行）。在新闻里常见名词形式：underwriter（承保人/承销商）。

summary.en: An underwriter evaluates risk and takes responsibility for it—most commonly in insurance, and also in finance when selling new stocks or bonds.
summary.zh: underwriter 指评估并承担风险责任的人或机构：最常见于保险核保，也可指证券发行中的承销商。

definition.en: A person or company that assesses risk and decides whether to provide insurance coverage, and on what terms and price (premium).
definition.zh: 核保人；核保机构（评估风险并决定是否承保，以及以什么条件与保费承保的个人或公司）。

examples.en: The underwriter asked for my medical history before approving the life insurance policy.
examples.zh: 核保人在批准寿险保单前要求我提供病史。

examples.en: If the underwriter considers you high-risk, your premium may be higher.
examples.zh: 如果核保人认为你风险较高，你的保费可能会更高。

definition.en: A person or bank that guarantees and helps sell a company’s new stocks or bonds, taking on the risk of unsold shares.
definition.zh: （证券）承销商；承销机构（为公司发行新股票或债券提供担保并协助销售，承担卖不出去的风险）。

examples.en: The company hired an investment bank as the underwriter for its IPO.
examples.zh: 这家公司聘请一家投行作为其首次公开募股（IPO）的承销商。

examples.en: Underwriters set the initial price range for the new shares.
examples.zh: 承销商会为新股设定初始价格区间。

extraExplanation: “underwriter”最早与海上贸易保险有关：过去有人会在保险合同下方（under）签名（write）来表示愿意承担一部分风险与赔付责任，因此得名。
学习提示：保险语境里常见搭配有“underwriting”（核保）、“underwrite a policy”（对某保单进行承保/核保）、“underwriting decision”（核保决定）；证券语境里常见“IPO underwriter”（IPO承销商）、“underwrite an offering”（承销发行）。

summary.en: Underwriting is the risk evaluation and approval process in insurance and lending, and it can also mean financing or guaranteeing a securities issue.
summary.zh: Underwriting 指保险与贷款中的风险评估与审批（核保/承保）流程，也可指证券发行中的承销与资金担保。

definition.en: The process of evaluating risk and deciding the terms (and price) for providing insurance or approving a loan/investment.
definition.zh: （保险/金融）承保（核保）：评估风险并决定是否提供保险或批准贷款/投资，以及相应条款和价格的过程。

examples.en: The underwriting for her mortgage took two weeks.
examples.zh: 她的房贷核保（审核）花了两周。

examples.en: During underwriting, the insurer asked for more medical records.
examples.zh: 在核保过程中，保险公司要求提供更多病历资料。

examples.en: Stricter underwriting standards can make it harder to get a loan.
examples.zh: 更严格的核保标准会让贷款更难获批。

definition.en: Providing financial backing for a project or issuing securities (often by guaranteeing to buy any unsold shares or bonds).
definition.zh: （投行/证券）承销：为项目或证券发行提供资金支持，常指承诺认购未售出的股票或债券。

examples.en: The bank handled the underwriting of the company’s IPO.
examples.zh: 这家银行负责该公司首次公开募股（IPO）的承销。

examples.en: Underwriting fees are part of the cost of issuing new bonds.
examples.zh: 承销费用是发行新债券成本的一部分。

extraExplanation: 词形来源：underwrite 原意是“在下面签字”，早期指在合同或海上保险单下方签名以承担风险；后来引申为“承保/承销”。
学习提示：在日常语境中，underwriting 最常见于保险与贷款审批；在商业金融语境中则多指投行的“承销（证券发行）”。常见搭配有 underwriting process/standards, underwriting approval, underwriting department.

summary.en: Undeserving means not worthy of something (often praise, help, or a reward) or not worthy of respect.
summary.zh: Undeserving 指“不配得到某物（常见如赞扬、帮助、奖励）”或“不值得尊重/认可”。

definition.en: Not worthy of something (such as praise, help, or a reward); not meriting it.
definition.zh: 不配得到（如赞扬、帮助或奖励）的；不值得的。

examples.en: He felt undeserving of all the praise he received.
examples.zh: 他觉得自己不配得到那么多赞扬。

examples.en: She didn’t want charity because she believed she was undeserving.
examples.zh: 她不想接受施舍，因为她认为自己不配。

definition.en: Not having good qualities; not worth respect or approval.
definition.zh: （人或事）不值得尊重或认可的；不体面的。

examples.en: The report described his behavior as undeserving of trust.
examples.zh: 报告称他的行为不值得信任。

examples.en: Such rude comments are undeserving of your attention.
examples.zh: 这种粗鲁的言论不值得你理会。

extraExplanation: “undeserving”由前缀 un-（表示否定）+ deserving（应得的）构成，常用于表达一种谦虚或内疚的心情（如“觉得自己不配被称赞”）。注意它既可描述“我不配得到某物”（undeserving of + 名词），也可描述“某人/某事不值得尊重”（undeserving of + 抽象名词，如 trust, respect, attention）。
常见搭配：undeserving of praise/help/credit/respect/attention。相反词：deserving（应得的）、worthy（值得的）。在写作中，“undeserving”语气偏正式，适合用于较严肃的语境。

summary.en: “Undesirability” means the quality of being unwanted or not suitable, often used in formal writing (e.g., reports, housing, policy).
summary.zh: “undesirability”指“不受欢迎/不理想/不合适”的性质或负面因素，常见于较正式的书面语（如报告、住房、政策等）。

definition.en: the quality of being unwanted, unattractive, or not suitable; a negative feature that makes someone or something less acceptable
definition.zh: 不受欢迎；不理想；不合适（指某人或某物具有让人不想要、不想接近的负面特质）

examples.en: The city is working to reduce the undesirability of the neighborhood by improving lighting and public services.
examples.zh: 市政府正通过改善照明和公共服务来降低该社区“不理想”的状况。

examples.en: In the report, noise and heavy traffic were listed as sources of undesirability for the new housing project.
examples.zh: 报告中把噪音和交通拥堵列为新住宅项目的“不受欢迎因素”。

examples.en: He worried that his past mistakes would add to his undesirability in the job market.
examples.zh: 他担心过去的错误会让自己在求职市场上更不受欢迎。

extraExplanation: “undesirability”常用于较正式或书面语（如报告、政策、房地产、社会研究），表示“让人不想要/不想选”的整体性质或一项负面因素。日常口语里更常说“not desirable”“unwanted”或直接说“a problem/ drawback”。
构词：undesirability = un-（否定）+ desirable（理想的/值得拥有的）+ -ity（名词后缀，表示性质）。常见搭配：reduce the undesirability（降低不利因素）、sources/factors of undesirability（不利因素来源）、social undesirability（社会层面的不受欢迎）。

summary.en: “Undesirable” most often means “not wanted or not suitable,” and it can also (more harshly) mean “an unwanted person.”
summary.zh: “Undesirable”最常指“不受欢迎/不合意的”，也可较带贬义地指“不受欢迎的人”。

definition.en: not wanted or not suitable; causing problems or unpleasant results
definition.zh: 不受欢迎的；不合意的；会带来麻烦或不良后果的

examples.en: Littering has undesirable effects on the environment.
examples.zh: 乱丢垃圾会对环境造成不良影响。

examples.en: The medicine may cause undesirable side effects.
examples.zh: 这种药可能会引起不良的副作用。

examples.en: They tried to avoid undesirable attention from the media.
examples.zh: 他们试图避免媒体带来的不必要关注。

definition.en: a person or thing considered unacceptable or unwanted (often used in the plural: “undesirables”)
definition.zh: 不受欢迎的人（或事物）；不良分子（常用复数“undesirables”）

examples.en: The club refused entry to people it labeled as undesirables.
examples.zh: 那家俱乐部拒绝让被它贴上“不受欢迎的人”标签的人入内。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：un-（否定）+ desirable（令人向往的、合意的）→ undesirable（不合意的）。
语域提醒：把人称为“undesirable(s)”带有强烈的排斥与污名化色彩，历史上也曾用于对特定群体的不公正标签；日常表达更常用“unwelcome/ unwanted people”或直接描述具体行为（e.g., “people causing trouble”）。

summary.en: “Undesirably” means something happens in an unwanted or unpleasant way, often used in formal writing to describe negative effects or outcomes.
summary.zh: “undesirably”表示“以不受欢迎/不理想的方式”，常用于较正式的语境，描述负面影响或结果。

definition.en: In an undesirable way; in a way that is not wanted or is unpleasant.
definition.zh: 以不理想的方式；不受欢迎地；令人不快地。

examples.en: The medicine can undesirably cause drowsiness for some people.
examples.zh: 这种药对一些人可能会不理想地引起嗜睡。

examples.en: Prices rose undesirably after the new policy was introduced.
examples.zh: 新政策推出后，价格出现了不理想的上涨。

extraExplanation: “undesirably”常用于较正式的语境（新闻、报告、学术写作），强调结果/影响“不希望发生”，常和副作用、后果、趋势等搭配（e.g., undesirably high costs 不理想的高成本）。
词形结构：un-（否定）+ desirable（理想的/值得拥有的）+ -ly（副词后缀）。常见替换表达有“unfortunately（不幸地）”“in an unwanted way（以不想要的方式）”，但“undesirably”更强调‘不符合期望/目标’。

summary.en: “Undetected” means not found or noticed yet.
summary.zh: “undetected”表示“尚未被发现或察觉”。

definition.en: Not noticed, discovered, or found; still hidden or unknown.
definition.zh: 未被察觉的；未被发现的；未被查出的。

examples.en: The mistake went undetected for months.
examples.zh: 这个错误好几个月都没有被发现。

examples.en: Many infections can remain undetected without testing.
examples.zh: 如果不做检测，许多感染可能一直无法被发现。

examples.en: The thief slipped out undetected.
examples.zh: 小偷悄悄溜走，没有被察觉。

extraExplanation: undetected = un-（否定前缀，表示“不”）+ detected（detect 的过去分词）。因此它常用来描述“本应被发现/识别/检测到，但没有”的状态。
常见搭配：go/remain undetected（一直未被发现），undetected error/defect（未检出的错误/缺陷），undetected illness/infection（未被发现的疾病/感染）。
语域提示：在日常生活、新闻与医学/科技语境中都很常见；在医学检测中强调“未被检测到”不等于“没有”，而是“尚未发现”。

summary.en: “Undeterred” means not discouraged and still determined to keep going despite obstacles.
summary.zh: “undeterred”表示“不气馁、未被阻碍吓退”，即使遇到困难仍决心继续。

definition.en: Not discouraged; still determined to continue even after difficulties, delays, or criticism.
definition.zh: 不气馁的；不被困难、拖延或批评吓退的；仍然坚定继续的。

examples.en: Undeterred by the rain, they finished the game.
examples.zh: 尽管下雨，他们仍不气馁，打完了比赛。

examples.en: She was undeterred by early rejections and kept applying.
examples.zh: 她没有被最初的拒绝打倒，继续投递申请。

examples.en: The team remained undeterred, confident they could solve the problem.
examples.zh: 团队依然不受挫，坚信能解决这个问题。

extraExplanation: “undeterred”常用于书面语或新闻报道里，强调“遇到阻碍仍继续前进”的态度；常见搭配是“undeterred by + 名词/动名词”（例如：undeterred by setbacks / by criticism）。
词源上由否定前缀“un-”（不）+“deter”（阻止、威慑）构成；语气比“brave（勇敢）”更强调“没有被拦住、仍继续做”。
文学与报道中常见固定句式："Undeterred, ..." 放句首作状语，表示“尽管如此/仍然……”。例如："Undeterred, he tried again."（他仍不气馁，又试了一次。）

summary.en: Undeveloped means not yet fully grown or improved, or (for land) not built on yet.
summary.zh: undeveloped 指尚未充分发展或完善的；也可指（土地）未开发、未建造的。

definition.en: Not fully grown, built, or improved; still basic or not advanced.
definition.zh: 未充分发展（或建设、开发）的；尚不成熟的；较原始的。

examples.en: The town is still undeveloped, with few roads and services.
examples.zh: 这个小镇仍未充分发展，道路和公共服务很少。

examples.en: He has good ideas, but the plan is undeveloped and needs more detail.
examples.zh: 他有好想法，但这个计划还不成熟，需要更多细节。

definition.en: In real estate or land use: not yet built on or used for housing/business.
definition.zh: （土地/房地产）未开发的；尚未建房或用于商业/住宅的。

examples.en: They bought an undeveloped piece of land near the lake.
examples.zh: 他们在湖边买了一块未开发的土地。

examples.en: The city wants to protect undeveloped areas as green space.
examples.zh: 这座城市希望把未开发地区保护为绿地。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：un-（否定前缀）+ developed（已发展/已开发）。所以 undeveloped 常见两大用法：①“尚不成熟/不完善”（用于技能、想法、系统等抽象事物）；②“未开发的土地”（用于地理、房地产语境）。
近义词对比：undeveloped 强调“还没发展到位/尚未开发”；underdeveloped 多用于国家或地区，带有“发展水平较低”的社会经济含义，语气更敏感，使用时注意场合。

summary.en: “Undid” is the past form of “undo,” meaning to reverse/cancel something or to unfasten what was fastened.
summary.zh: “undid”是“undo”的过去式/过去分词，表示撤销/取消某事，或把扣好/系好的东西解开。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “undo”; to reverse an action, cancel an effect, or open something that was fastened
definition.zh: “undo”的过去式和过去分词；指撤销/取消某个动作或影响；也可指把系好/扣好/扎好的东西解开

examples.en: I accidentally deleted the file, but I undid the change.
examples.zh: 我不小心删除了文件，但我撤销了这个更改。

examples.en: He undid his seat belt after the car stopped.
examples.zh: 车停下后，他解开了安全带。

examples.en: She undid the knot and opened the bag.
examples.zh: 她解开结，把袋子打开了。

extraExplanation: “undid”常见于两类语境：①软件/工作流程里表示“撤销（undo）”，例如“Undo/Redo（撤销/重做）”；②日常动作里表示“解开/松开”，如解开纽扣（undo a button）、拉链（undo a zipper）、安全带（undo a seat belt）。
注意拼写：undo → undid → undone（过去分词也常用“undone”，如“has undone”）。

summary.en: Undifferentiated means not clearly divided into distinct types or parts, or (in biology) not yet specialized into a particular cell type.
summary.zh: Undifferentiated 指“未区分的/不分类型的”，也可指（生物）“未分化、未特化成某种细胞类型的”。

definition.en: Not divided into clear types or parts; not shown as distinct or separate.
definition.zh: 未分化的；未区分开的；没有明显类别或差别的。

examples.en: The report treats the audience as an undifferentiated group.
examples.zh: 这份报告把受众当作一个没有区分的整体来处理。

examples.en: From a distance, the crowd looked like an undifferentiated mass.
examples.zh: 从远处看，人群像一团难以分辨的整体。

definition.en: (Biology) Not specialized in structure or function; not developed into a particular cell type.
definition.zh: （生物）未分化的；未特化成某种细胞类型的。

examples.en: Stem cells start out undifferentiated and can become many kinds of cells.
examples.zh: 干细胞起初是未分化的，之后可以变成多种细胞。

examples.en: Under the microscope, the tissue still appeared undifferentiated.
examples.zh: 在显微镜下，这种组织看起来仍未分化。

extraExplanation: 构词：un-（否定）+ differentiate（区分/使分化）+ -ed（形容词后缀），字面意思是“没有被区分/没有发生分化”。
常见搭配：undifferentiated mass（难以分辨的一团/整体）、undifferentiated cells（未分化细胞）、undifferentiated market（未细分市场）。在社会话题中，用它可能暗示“把不同的人当成同一类”，语气有时带批评。

summary.en: Undignified describes behavior or situations that are not calm, respectable, or fitting, often causing embarrassment.
summary.zh: Undignified 用来形容不庄重、不体面、失去应有分寸的行为或情境，常带有“令人尴尬/丢脸”的意味。

definition.en: Not showing dignity; not calm, serious, or respectable in the way you behave or appear.
definition.zh: 不庄重的；不体面的；缺乏尊严的（行为或外表不够沉稳、严肃或令人尊敬）。

examples.en: He made an undignified attempt to climb over the fence and fell in front of everyone.
examples.zh: 他很不体面地试图翻过栅栏，结果当着大家的面摔倒了。

examples.en: She kept her voice steady, even in an undignified situation.
examples.zh: 即使在很不体面的情境里，她的声音仍保持平稳。

definition.en: Embarrassing or humiliating; making someone seem silly or less worthy of respect.
definition.zh: 令人尴尬或丢脸的；使人显得可笑、掉价或不值得尊重的。

examples.en: It would be undignified to beg for attention after the decision was final.
examples.zh: 在决定已成定局后再去乞求关注，会显得很丢脸。

examples.en: They turned a serious debate into an undignified shouting match.
examples.zh: 他们把严肃的辩论变成了不体面的互相叫骂。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：un- 表示否定；dignified 来自 dignity（尊严、体面）。undignified 常用来委婉地批评“有失身份/不够得体”，比直接说 rude（粗鲁）或 shameful（可耻）语气更含蓄。
语用提示：undignified 往往强调“在社交场合不够体面、失去应有的冷静和分寸”，例如争吵、失控、当众出糗等；并不一定表示道德上错误。

summary.en: Undirected means either not guided toward a clear direction/goal, or (in math/computing) having no direction like an undirected graph.
summary.zh: Undirected 指“缺乏明确方向/引导”，也可指（数学/计算机）“无向的”，如无向图。

definition.en: Not having a set direction, goal, or guidance; not guided or supervised.
definition.zh: 没有明确方向或目标的；不受指导或监督的。

examples.en: After graduation, he felt undirected and unsure what to do next.
examples.zh: 毕业后，他感到没有方向，不确定下一步该做什么。

examples.en: The project became undirected without a clear leader.
examples.zh: 没有明确负责人后，这个项目变得缺乏方向。

definition.en: (Math/Computing) Describing a graph or connection where links go both ways, not from one specific node to another.
definition.zh: （数学/计算机）指无向的（图/连接）：边没有方向，连接是双向的。

examples.en: In an undirected graph, an edge between A and B means A is connected to B and B is connected to A.
examples.zh: 在无向图中，A 和 B 之间的一条边表示 A 连接 B，同时 B 也连接 A。

examples.en: Friendship networks are often modeled as undirected graphs.
examples.zh: 友谊网络常常用无向图来建模。

extraExplanation: 在日常英语里，undirected 常用于形容“人生/努力/讨论”缺乏明确目标或引导；在计算机与数学语境中，它几乎是一个固定术语，用来对比 directed（有向的）。
词形来源：un-（否定前缀）+ directed（被引导的/有方向的）。

summary.en: Undisclosed means not made public or not revealed.
summary.zh: undisclosed 表示“未公开、未披露（信息）的”。

definition.en: Not revealed or made known; kept secret or private.
definition.zh: 未公开的；未披露的；保密的。

examples.en: The company kept the terms of the deal undisclosed.
examples.zh: 公司将这笔交易的条款保密，未予披露。

examples.en: For safety reasons, her location remains undisclosed.
examples.zh: 出于安全原因，她的位置仍未公开。

examples.en: He has an undisclosed reason for leaving the job.
examples.zh: 他离职的原因未披露。

extraExplanation: “undisclosed”常见于新闻报道、法律文件、商业公告等较正式的语境，语气比“secret/hidden”更中性，强调“未对外说明”，不一定暗示有阴谋或不正当。
构词：前缀 un-（否定）+ disclosed（已披露的）。disclose 的意思是“披露、公开（信息）”。因此 undisclosed = “未被披露的”。
常见搭配：undisclosed amount（未披露的金额）、undisclosed location（未公开的地点）、undisclosed terms/details（未披露的条款/细节）、undisclosed investors（未公开身份的投资者）。

summary.en: Undiscovered means not found or known yet, often describing unknown things, talents, places, or areas that haven’t been explored.
summary.zh: Undiscovered 指“尚未被发现或了解的”，常用来形容未知的事物、未被发掘的才能、或尚未探索的地点/领域。

definition.en: Not found, explored, or revealed yet; still unknown.
definition.zh: 尚未被发现、探索或揭示的；未知的。

examples.en: Scientists are still searching for undiscovered species in the rainforest.
examples.zh: 科学家仍在雨林中寻找尚未被发现的物种。

examples.en: She believes there are undiscovered talents inside her.
examples.zh: 她相信自己身上还有尚未被发掘的才能。

examples.en: The museum displayed artifacts from an undiscovered tomb.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了来自一座尚未被发现的墓葬的文物。

definition.en: Not visited or traveled to (used especially for places).
definition.zh: （尤指地点）尚未有人到访或踏足的。

examples.en: They dreamed of hiking through undiscovered valleys.
examples.zh: 他们梦想穿越人迹罕至的山谷徒步。

examples.en: The novel describes an undiscovered island far from any trade route.
examples.zh: 这部小说描写了一座远离任何贸易航线的无人知晓的岛屿。

extraExplanation: “undiscovered”由否定前缀 un-（表示“未/不”）+ discovered 构成，常见搭配有 undiscovered country（未知之地）、undiscovered talent（未被发掘的才能）、undiscovered territory（未探索领域）。
文学用法中，“the undiscovered country”常让人联想到莎士比亚《哈姆雷特》里对死亡与未知世界的比喻（原句为“the undiscover’d country”）。

summary.en: Undisguised means openly shown and not hidden—easy to see.
summary.zh: Undisguised 指“公开表现的、毫不掩饰的”，一眼就能看出来。

definition.en: Openly shown; not hidden or concealed; obvious and easy to notice.
definition.zh: 公开的；不加掩饰的；明显的、容易看出来的。

examples.en: She spoke with undisguised anger.
examples.zh: 她带着毫不掩饰的愤怒说话。

examples.en: His undisguised joy made everyone smile.
examples.zh: 他毫不掩饰的喜悦让大家都笑了。

examples.en: The report expressed undisguised criticism of the policy.
examples.zh: 报告对该政策表达了直白、毫不掩饰的批评。

extraExplanation: 词源上来自 dis+guise（把……伪装/掩饰），undisguised 表示“没有伪装、没有掩饰”。常用来修饰情感或态度（anger, delight, contempt, admiration, fear 等），语气比 plain/clear 更强调“故意不藏着”或“根本藏不住”。
常见搭配：undisguised + anger/hatred/contempt/delight/joy/admiration；也可与副词连用：quite/utterly undisguised（完全不加掩饰）。

summary.en: Undisputed means accepted by everyone as true, correct, or the best, with no real disagreement.
summary.zh: Undisputed 指“公认的、无可争议的”，强调几乎没有人提出反对或质疑。

definition.en: Accepted as true, correct, or the best, with no disagreement.
definition.zh: 公认的；无可争议的；被普遍接受为真实、正确或最好的。

examples.en: She is the undisputed leader of the team.
examples.zh: 她是这个团队公认的领导者。

examples.en: The city is the undisputed center of the region’s finance industry.
examples.zh: 这座城市是该地区金融业无可争议的中心。

examples.en: His undisputed authority made people stop arguing.
examples.zh: 他无可争议的权威让人们停止了争论。

definition.en: Not questioned or challenged in a formal way (for example, in law, politics, or competition).
definition.zh: （在法律、政治或竞赛等正式场合）未被质疑或挑战的。

examples.en: The election results were undisputed.
examples.zh: 选举结果没有受到质疑。

examples.en: She won the match with an undisputed score.
examples.zh: 她以无可争议的比分赢得了比赛。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：un-（否定）+ disputed（有争议的）。所以 undisputed 就是“没有争议的”。
常见搭配：undisputed champion（无可争议的冠军）、undisputed leader（公认的领袖）、undisputed fact（无可争议的事实）、undisputed authority（公认的权威）。
语体提示：undisputed 常用于较正式的语境（新闻、评论、学术写作），强调“几乎没人反对”。在拳击等运动中，undisputed champion 还有更具体含义：同时拥有该级别所有主要组织的冠军头衔。

summary.en: Undistorted means not changed from the original shape or meaning—clear, accurate, and without distortion.
summary.zh: Undistorted 指保持原样、不变形或不失真——清晰、准确、忠实于原始内容。

definition.en: Not changed from the original form; not twisted, stretched, or altered.
definition.zh: 未被扭曲的；未变形的；保持原样的。

examples.en: The mirror gave an undistorted reflection of her face.
examples.zh: 这面镜子呈现出她脸部未失真的倒影。

examples.en: The photo is undistorted, so the building looks straight and natural.
examples.zh: 这张照片没有变形，所以建筑看起来笔直自然。

definition.en: (Of sound, signals, or information) Clear and accurate, without added noise or changes that affect the true meaning.
definition.zh: （指声音、信号或信息）清晰准确的；无失真、无被干扰而改变真实内容的。

examples.en: The microphone recorded an undistorted voice.
examples.zh: 麦克风录下了无失真的声音。

examples.en: We need an undistorted signal to measure the data correctly.
examples.zh: 我们需要无失真的信号，才能正确测量数据。

extraExplanation: “undistorted”常见于两类语境：①视觉/形状（如镜子、照片、地图投影）强调“形状比例没被拉扯变形”；②音频/通信/电子工程强调“声音或信号没有失真（distortion）”，更接近“清晰、忠实还原原始内容”。

summary.en: Undisturbed means either kept in its original state (not touched or interfered with) or calm and not interrupted (quiet, not bothered).
summary.zh: Undisturbed 表示“保持原状、未被动过/干扰过”，也可表示“安静不受打扰、未被中断”。

definition.en: Not interrupted, changed, or interfered with; left as it is.
definition.zh: 未被打扰的；未被改变或干扰的；保持原状的。

examples.en: Please leave the documents undisturbed until the audit is finished.
examples.zh: 审计结束前，请不要动这些文件，让它们保持原状。

examples.en: The crime scene was kept undisturbed for the investigators.
examples.zh: 为便于调查人员取证，犯罪现场被保持原状。

definition.en: Not bothered or woken; calm and quiet.
definition.zh: 不受打扰的；安静平和的（未被吵醒或惊扰）。

examples.en: She enjoyed an undisturbed night of sleep.
examples.zh: 她睡了一个安稳觉，没有被打扰。

examples.en: I need a few undisturbed minutes to finish this email.
examples.zh: 我需要几分钟不被打扰的时间把这封邮件写完。

extraExplanation: “undisturbed”由前缀 un-（否定）+ disturbed（被打扰的）构成，常用于两类场景：一类是“保持原状/未经动过”（如现场、证据、文件），另一类是“安静不受打扰”（如睡眠、时间、自然环境）。在正式语境里，和“kept/left/remain undisturbed”搭配很常见。

summary.en: Undivided means “not split” (physically or emotionally), and it often describes complete focus in the phrase “undivided attention.”
summary.zh: Undivided 表示“未被分开、完整的”，也可指“团结一致的”；常见搭配是 undivided attention（全神贯注）。

definition.en: Not separated into parts; whole, complete, and still together.
definition.zh: 未被分开的；完整的；保持在一起的。

examples.en: The land remained undivided after their parents died.
examples.zh: 父母去世后，那块土地仍然没有分割。

examples.en: Please keep the document undivided—don’t split it into sections.
examples.zh: 请保持文件完整，不要把它分成几部分。

definition.en: United in purpose or feeling; not split by disagreement.
definition.zh: 团结一致的；（意见、情感）没有分歧的。

examples.en: The community stayed undivided during the crisis.
examples.zh: 在危机期间，社区保持团结一致。

examples.en: They gave their undivided support to the project.
examples.zh: 他们对这个项目给予了毫无保留的支持。

definition.en: (In the phrase “undivided attention”) Fully focused; not distracted.
definition.zh: （常用于“undivided attention/全神贯注”）专注的；不分心的。

examples.en: She listened with undivided attention.
examples.zh: 她全神贯注地听着。

examples.en: This task needs your undivided attention for ten minutes.
examples.zh: 这项任务需要你十分钟内全神贯注。

extraExplanation: “undivided”由前缀 un-（否定）+ divided（被分开的）构成，字面意思就是“没有被分开”。
常见固定搭配：undivided attention（全神贯注），undivided support/loyalty（坚定/毫无保留的支持/忠诚）。
写作与正式语境中也常见“an undivided country/nation”（一个不分裂的国家），强调政治或社会上的统一。

summary.en: “Undo” means to reverse a previous action (especially on a computer) or to untie/loosen something.
summary.zh: “undo”表示撤销之前的操作（尤其是电脑里）或解开/松开某物。

definition.en: to reverse an action; to cancel what was done before
definition.zh: 撤销（之前的操作）；取消先前所做的事

examples.en: I accidentally deleted the file, so I clicked “Undo.”
examples.zh: 我不小心删了文件，所以我点了“撤销”。

examples.en: You can undo your last change by pressing Ctrl+Z (or Command+Z on a Mac).
examples.zh: 你可以按 Ctrl+Z（Mac 上是 Command+Z）来撤销上一次的更改。

definition.en: to untie; to loosen something that is tied or fastened
definition.zh: 解开；松开（打结或系紧的东西）

examples.en: He undid his shoelaces and took off his shoes.
examples.zh: 他解开鞋带，把鞋脱了。

examples.en: Please undo the knot slowly so it doesn’t tighten.
examples.zh: 请慢慢把结解开，免得越拉越紧。

extraExplanation: 在软件和应用里，“Undo”常作为按钮/菜单项出现（首字母常大写），意思是“撤销上一步操作”。对应的常见反义功能是“Redo（重做）”。
词形上，undo = un-（表示“反向/取消”）+ do（做），所以本义就是“把做过的事反过来”。

summary.en: “Undoable” most often means “cannot be undone or reversed,” though it is sometimes used to mean “can be undone.”
summary.zh: “Undoable”通常表示“无法撤销/不可逆”，但有时也会被用来表示“可撤销”，使用时需注意语境避免歧义。

definition.en: Not able to be undone, reversed, or fixed; impossible to change back to the earlier state.
definition.zh: 无法撤销的；不能逆转或修复的；无法回到原来状态的。

examples.en: Sending the email was undoable—you can’t take it back once it’s delivered.
examples.zh: 邮件一旦发出就很难撤回——送达后就没法收回了。

examples.en: Some damage to the painting is undoable, so the museum handles it very carefully.
examples.zh: 对这幅画的某些损伤是无法修复的，所以博物馆会非常小心地处理。

definition.en: Able to be undone; reversible (less common usage).
definition.zh: 可以撤销的；可逆的（较少见用法）。

examples.en: This change is undoable if you don’t like it—just click “Reset.”
examples.zh: 如果你不喜欢，这个改动是可以撤销的——点击“重置”就行。

extraExplanation: “undoable”由“undo（撤销/解开/取消）+ -able（能够……的）”构成。日常英语里更常见的表达通常是“irreversible（不可逆的）”“can’t be undone（无法撤销）”。注意：在实际使用中，“undoable”有时会被理解成“可撤销的”，因此在正式或重要场景里，建议用更明确的词（如“irreversible / reversible”）避免歧义。

summary.en: “Undocumented” usually means either (1) lacking official legal papers (often about immigration status) or (2) not written down or described in records/manuals.
summary.zh: Undocumented 常指（1）缺少官方合法证件（常用于移民身份语境）；或（2）未被记录、未写入文档/资料中。

definition.en: Not recorded in official papers or legal documents; without required authorization or formal proof.
definition.zh: 未被官方文件记录的；（通常指身份/状态）没有合法证件或未获授权的。

examples.en: He is an undocumented immigrant who has lived here for ten years.
examples.zh: 他是一名无证移民，已经在这里生活了十年。

examples.en: The clinic offers care to undocumented workers.
examples.zh: 这家诊所为无证工人提供医疗服务。

definition.en: Not written down or formally described; lacking documentation or clear records.
definition.zh: 未被记载的；没有成文记录或说明的。

examples.en: Some features of the old system are undocumented.
examples.zh: 旧系统的一些功能没有文档说明。

examples.en: This practice is common but undocumented in the manual.
examples.zh: 这种做法很常见，但说明书里没有写。

extraExplanation: 在美国语境中，undocumented 最常与 immigrant（移民）搭配，强调“缺少合法身份文件”，比 illegal（非法的）更中性、也更常用于新闻与公共讨论中。
在科技/工作场景里，undocumented 常指“没有写进文档”的功能、接口或规则（例如 undocumented feature/API），意思更接近“未被记录/未公开说明”。

summary.en: “Undone” means not finished, not fastened/closed, or (informally) emotionally upset.
summary.zh: “undone”可指未完成的、未扣好/松开的，或（口语）情绪崩溃/心烦意乱的。

definition.en: Not finished or not completed; left incomplete.
definition.zh: 未完成的；没做完的。

examples.en: I still have some homework undone.
examples.zh: 我还有一些作业没做完。

examples.en: The project remained undone because we ran out of time.
examples.zh: 因为时间不够，这个项目一直没完成。

definition.en: Not fastened, tied, or closed (for example, a button, zipper, knot, or hair).
definition.zh: 未扣好/未系好/未拉好；松开的（如纽扣、拉链、结或头发）。

examples.en: Your shoelaces are undone—watch your step.
examples.zh: 你的鞋带松了——小心脚下。

examples.en: He left his jacket undone in the warm weather.
examples.zh: 天气热，他把夹克敞着没扣。

definition.en: Emotionally upset, worried, or shaken (more informal).
definition.zh: 心烦意乱的；情绪崩溃/被打击的（较口语）。

examples.en: She was undone by the bad news.
examples.zh: 这个坏消息让她崩溃了。

examples.en: I felt completely undone after the argument.
examples.zh: 争吵之后我觉得心里特别乱。

extraExplanation: “undone”通常是“un-（否定前缀）+ done（完成的）”，所以最核心的感觉是“把完成的状态取消了”。既可以指事情没做完，也可以指扣子/鞋带等“没扣好、没系好”。
常见表达：**come undone**（松开/散开；也可指情绪失控），如：*My plan came undone.*（我的计划泡汤了/没实现。）
在文学或正式语境里，**undone**有时带一点“散乱、失序”的画面感，比如衣着不整或心神不宁。

summary.en: Undoubted means something is certain and not in doubt.
summary.zh: undoubted表示“确定无疑、毫无疑问、不容置疑”。

definition.en: certainly true; not questioned or doubted; clear and obvious.
definition.zh: 毫无疑问的；确定无疑的；不容置疑的。

examples.en: It is undoubted that regular practice improves your English.
examples.zh: 毫无疑问，规律练习会提高你的英语。

examples.en: She has an undoubted talent for music.
examples.zh: 她在音乐方面有不容置疑的天赋。

examples.en: His leadership was of undoubted value during the crisis.
examples.zh: 在危机期间，他的领导力具有无可置疑的价值。

extraExplanation: “undoubted”比“no doubt”更正式，常见于书面语或较严肃的语境；日常口语里更常说“no doubt / definitely / certainly”。
常见搭配：undoubted fact（无可争辩的事实）, undoubted truth（确凿的真理）, undoubted right（无可置疑的权利）, undoubted talent（公认的才华）。
用法提示：可以用“It is undoubted that + 从句”表示“……是毫无疑问的”，也可以直接放在名词前作定语，如“undoubted success”。

summary.en: “Undoubtedly” means “certainly/without doubt,” often in a formal tone.
summary.zh: “undoubtedly”表示“毫无疑问地/肯定”，语气偏正式，用来强调确定性。

definition.en: Without doubt; certainly; used to show strong confidence that something is true.
definition.zh: 毫无疑问地；确实；用于强调你非常确定某事为真。

examples.en: She is undoubtedly one of the best teachers in the school.
examples.zh: 她毫无疑问是这所学校里最优秀的老师之一。

examples.en: The plan will undoubtedly take longer than we expected.
examples.zh: 这个计划肯定会比我们预期花更长时间。

extraExplanation: 语气与用法：undoubtedly 常用于正式或书面语，表示“我非常确定”。语气比 probably（可能）更强，但比 absolutely（绝对、完全）稍显克制一些。
常见位置：多放在句首或动词前（Undoubtedly, ... / will undoubtedly ...），用来加强判断或预测。

summary.en: “Undramatic” describes something calm, plain, and not exaggerated or emotional.
summary.zh: “undramatic”用来形容事情或反应平淡、冷静、不夸张也不煽情。

definition.en: Not dramatic; calm and not exaggerated or emotional.
definition.zh: 不戏剧化的；平静的、不夸张的、不情绪化的。

examples.en: Her reaction was undramatic—she just nodded and kept working.
examples.zh: 她的反应很不戏剧化——只是点了点头，继续工作。

examples.en: The meeting ended in an undramatic way, with a clear plan and no arguments.
examples.zh: 会议以一种不戏剧化的方式结束：计划很清晰，也没有争吵。

extraExplanation: “un-”是一个常见前缀，表示“否定/相反”。因此 undramatic = not dramatic（不夸张、不煽情）。
在日常英语里，undramatic 常用来形容“事情的发展/结局很平淡”“反应很冷静”，语气通常偏中性或略带称赞（像是：成熟、稳重）。

summary.en: “Undress” means to remove clothes (from yourself or someone else), often used in bedtime or medical contexts.
summary.zh: “undress”指脱衣服（自己或给别人脱），常用于睡前或医疗检查等语境。

definition.en: to take off your clothes; to remove clothing from yourself
definition.zh: 脱衣服；把衣服从自己身上脱下

examples.en: He went into his room to undress and get ready for bed.
examples.zh: 他进房间脱衣服，准备睡觉。

examples.en: Please undress behind the curtain and put on the gown.
examples.zh: 请在帘子后面脱衣服，然后穿上检查袍。

definition.en: to take off someone else’s clothes
definition.zh: 给某人脱衣服

examples.en: The nurse helped the patient undress for the exam.
examples.zh: 护士帮病人脱衣服做检查。

examples.en: She undressed the baby and changed the diaper.
examples.zh: 她给宝宝脱了衣服并换了尿布。

extraExplanation: “undress”在医疗场景很常见（如体检、手术前），语气通常中性、正式。日常生活中也可用“take off your clothes / get changed”来表达，更口语、更委婉。
注意语境：在非医疗/亲密关系等不合适的场合直接说“undress”可能让人觉得冒犯或带有性暗示。更安全的说法有“get changed”“change clothes”。

summary.en: “Undue” means excessive, inappropriate, or not justified—more than what is fair or acceptable.
summary.zh: “undue”表示“过度的、不适当的、无正当理由的”，即超出合理或应有的范围。

definition.en: More than is fair, appropriate, or acceptable; excessive or improper.
definition.zh: 过度的；不适当的；不应有的。

examples.en: The court decided that the contract was signed under undue pressure.
examples.zh: 法院认定该合同是在不当压力下签署的。

examples.en: Parents should not put undue stress on a child’s grades.
examples.zh: 家长不应给孩子的成绩施加过度压力。

examples.en: She apologized for causing you undue trouble.
examples.zh: 她为给你带来不必要的麻烦而道歉。

definition.en: (In law or formal writing) Not legally justified or not owed.
definition.zh: （法律/正式用语）无正当理由的；不应得的；不当的。

examples.en: He claimed he was denied his rights without undue cause.
examples.zh: 他声称自己在没有正当理由的情况下被剥夺了权利。

examples.en: The fee was considered undue and had to be refunded.
examples.zh: 该费用被认定为不当收费，必须退还。

extraExplanation: “undue”由“un-（不）+ due（应得的/应有的）”构成，所以核心意思是“超出应有范围”“不该发生/不该有”。常见搭配：undue pressure（不当压力）、undue influence（不当影响/不正当影响，法律中常见）、undue stress（过度压力）、undue delay（不应有的延误）、undue hardship（过度困难/不合理负担）。
语气偏正式，常用于法律、新闻和学术写作；日常口语里也会用，但多出现在固定搭配中。

summary.en: Undulant describes something that moves or looks like gentle waves.
summary.zh: undulant 用来形容“像柔和波浪一样起伏或波动”的事物。

definition.en: Having a smooth, wave-like shape or motion; gently rising and falling.
definition.zh: 呈波浪状的；起伏的；波动的（形状或运动平缓像波浪）。

examples.en: We drove through undulant hills that rose and fell like waves.
examples.zh: 我们开车穿过起伏的丘陵，像波浪一样一高一低。

examples.en: The undulant surface of the lake reflected the sunset.
examples.zh: 湖面微微起伏，映着夕阳。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：undulant 来自拉丁语 unda（“波浪”），和 undulate（“起伏、波动”）同源。常用于描写地形（undulant hills/fields）、水面（undulant surface）或头发等自然、柔和的波浪形态。
用法辨析：undulant 常带有“柔和、连绵”的感觉；rolling hills（连绵起伏的丘陵）更口语、更常见；wavy 更适合描述头发、线条等“波浪形”。

summary.en: Undulate means to move or look like gentle waves, rising and falling smoothly.
summary.zh: Undulate 指像波浪一样平滑地起伏或呈波浪状。

definition.en: to move in smooth, wave-like motions; to rise and fall gently
definition.zh: 起伏波动；呈波浪状移动（或上下起落）

examples.en: The hills undulate gently across the countryside.
examples.zh: 山丘在乡间缓缓起伏。

examples.en: The flag undulated in the wind.
examples.zh: 旗帜在风中波动。

examples.en: She spoke with a voice that seemed to undulate, soft then strong.
examples.zh: 她说话的声音仿佛有起伏变化，时而轻柔，时而有力。

definition.en: (of a surface, line, or shape) having a wavy form; not straight or flat
definition.zh: （表面、线条或形状）波浪状的；起伏不平的

examples.en: They followed an undulate path along the coast.
examples.zh: 他们沿着海岸走在一条蜿蜒起伏的小路上。

examples.en: The artist drew an undulate line to suggest movement.
examples.zh: 画家画了一条波浪线来表现动感。

extraExplanation: 词源：来自拉丁语 *undula*（“小波浪”），与 *wave*（波浪）意义相近，因此常用于描写地形（undulating hills）、旗帜、头发、音乐/声音等“像波一样”的起伏。
用法提示：*undulate* 比 *move* 更形象、文学感更强，强调“连续、柔和的波动”。常见搭配：*undulate gently/slowly*；*undulating hills/landscape/road*。

summary.en: Undulating describes something that rises and falls smoothly like waves, such as hills, roads, hair, or flowing movement/sound.
summary.zh: Undulating 指像波浪一样平滑地起伏，可形容山丘、道路、头发或流动的动作/声音等。

definition.en: Moving with smooth, wave-like rises and falls; gently wavy.
definition.zh: 起伏的；波浪状起落的；（线条或地形）蜿蜒起伏的。

examples.en: We drove through undulating hills covered with grass.
examples.zh: 我们开车穿过一片长满青草、连绵起伏的山丘。

examples.en: Her undulating hair looked like soft waves.
examples.zh: 她的头发呈波浪状起伏，看起来很柔软。

examples.en: The road is undulating, so drive carefully.
examples.zh: 这条路起伏不平，所以要小心驾驶。

definition.en: Moving or flowing in a smooth, wave-like way (often describing water, sound, light, or movement).
definition.zh: （常指水流、声音、光线或动作）以平滑的波浪式方式流动/移动的。

examples.en: Undulating music filled the hall.
examples.zh: 起伏流动的音乐充满了大厅。

examples.en: The dancer made undulating movements with her arms.
examples.zh: 舞者用手臂做出波浪般起伏的动作。

extraExplanation: “undulating”来自动词“undulate”（起伏、呈波浪状运动），常用于描写地形（undulating hills/land）、头发（undulating hair）、道路（undulating road）以及艺术性动作或声音（undulating rhythm）。它比“wavy”更有书面感、更强调连续、柔和的起落。

summary.en: Unduly means ‘excessively’—more than is reasonable, necessary, or fair.
summary.zh: Unduly 表示“过度地”，即超过合理、必要或公平的程度。

definition.en: More than is reasonable, necessary, or fair; excessively.
definition.zh: 过度地；不合理地；不必要地（强调“超过应有程度”）。

examples.en: The report unduly criticizes the team for a minor mistake.
examples.zh: 这份报告因为一个小错误而过度地批评了团队。

examples.en: Don’t let one comment unduly influence your decision.
examples.zh: 别让一句评论过度地影响你的决定。

examples.en: She was unduly worried about the exam.
examples.zh: 她对考试担心得有些过度。

extraExplanation: “unduly”比较正式，常用于写作或新闻中，意思是“超过应有/合理的程度”。常见搭配：unduly harsh（过于严厉）、unduly influenced（受到过度影响）、unduly alarmed（过度惊慌）、unduly burdensome（负担过重）。
构词：un-（否定/相反）+ duly（适当地、正当地）。duly 源自 “due”（应得的、应有的），所以 unduly 直观理解为“不适当地、超过应有程度地”。

summary.en: Undying means “immortal” or “lasting for a very long time without fading,” often used in a literary way.
summary.zh: Undying 意为“不死的/不朽的”，也可指“长久不衰、永不磨灭的”，常带文学色彩。

definition.en: Never dying; lasting forever; immortal.
definition.zh: 不死的；永恒的；不朽的。

examples.en: In many myths, gods are described as undying.
examples.zh: 在许多神话里，众神被描述为不死的。

examples.en: The story imagines an undying hero who lives through many centuries.
examples.zh: 这个故事想象了一位不朽的英雄，活过了许多个世纪。

definition.en: Continuing for a very long time; not fading or ending (often about love, loyalty, fame, or memory).
definition.zh: 持久不衰的；不会消失或终止的（常指爱、忠诚、名声或记忆）。

examples.en: She showed undying loyalty to her friends.
examples.zh: 她对朋友表现出不渝的忠诚。

examples.en: The artist’s work earned him undying fame.
examples.zh: 这位艺术家的作品为他赢得了不朽的名声。

examples.en: The town kept an undying memory of those who helped after the disaster.
examples.zh: 这个小镇对灾后提供帮助的人保持着永不磨灭的记忆。

extraExplanation: “undying”由前缀 un-（表示否定）+ dying（正在死亡的）构成，字面意思是“不会死亡”。在文学里常用来夸张表达情感或名声“长久不灭”。
常见搭配：undying love（永恒的爱）、undying devotion（不渝的奉献/挚爱）、undying hatred（不共戴天/长久的仇恨）、undying fame（不朽的名声）。
词语带有较强的文学色彩；日常口语里也可用 everlasting / never-ending 来表达“长久的”。

summary.en: Unearth means to dig something out of the ground or to discover/reveal something hidden.
summary.zh: Unearth 指“挖出（埋在地下的东西）”，也指“发现/揭露隐藏的事物”。

definition.en: to dig something out of the ground; to uncover something buried
definition.zh: 把某物从土里挖出来；挖出被埋的东西

examples.en: Workers unearthed ancient pottery while building the road.
examples.zh: 工人在修路时挖出了古代陶器。

examples.en: A dog can unearth a bone in seconds.
examples.zh: 狗能在几秒钟内把骨头刨出来。

definition.en: to discover or reveal something that was hidden, forgotten, or secret
definition.zh: 发现或揭露隐藏、被遗忘或保密的事情

examples.en: The journalist unearthed new evidence about the case.
examples.zh: 记者发现了关于此案的新证据。

examples.en: While cleaning, she unearthed old letters from college.
examples.zh: 打扫时，她翻出了大学时期的旧信件。

examples.en: The research team unearthed a surprising connection between the two diseases.
examples.zh: 研究团队发现了这两种疾病之间令人惊讶的关联。

extraExplanation: “unearth”由前缀“un-”（表示“去掉/使不再处于某种状态”）+“earth”（土地）组成，字面意思是“从土里弄出来”，因此很自然地引申为“揭露真相、发现线索”。
常见搭配：unearth evidence / facts / secrets（发现证据/事实/秘密）；unearth a relic / artifact（出土遗物/文物）。
语体上偏书面，新闻报道、历史/考古、调查写作中很常见；日常口语里也可用，但也常用 find / discover / dig up 来替换（其中 dig up 更口语、也更像“挖出来”）。

summary.en: Uncannily strange or supernatural; sometimes used to describe beauty that feels beyond the human world.
summary.zh: 表示“怪异神秘、超自然”，也可形容“美得不真实、超凡脱俗”。

definition.en: Strange, mysterious, or not from the normal human world; like something supernatural.
definition.zh: 怪异神秘的；超自然的；不像人间的。

examples.en: The forest was silent in an unearthly way.
examples.zh: 森林安静得有点不像人间。

examples.en: She heard an unearthly sound coming from the old house.
examples.zh: 她听到老房子里传来一种怪异的声音。

examples.en: The movie uses unearthly creatures to build tension.
examples.zh: 这部电影用超自然生物来营造紧张感。

definition.en: (Of beauty or light) So extraordinary that it seems beyond human experience.
definition.zh: （指美或光）美得不真实；超凡脱俗的。

examples.en: The sunrise over the mountains had an unearthly beauty.
examples.zh: 群山之上的日出美得超凡脱俗。

examples.en: Her voice was soft and almost unearthly.
examples.zh: 她的声音轻柔，几乎像天籁一样。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：unearthly = un-（不、非）+ earthly（尘世的、人间的），字面意思是“非尘世的”。常用于文学、恐怖/奇幻作品或描写氛围（unearthly silence / glow / scream）。
使用区别：unearthly 多强调“超自然/不真实的感觉”；如果只是“非常漂亮”，也可用 ethereal（空灵的）、otherworldly（异世界般的）。

summary.en: Unease means a nervous, worried, or uncomfortable feeling that something may be wrong.
summary.zh: Unease 指一种隐隐的紧张、担忧或不舒服的感觉，觉得可能出问题。

definition.en: a feeling of worry, nervousness, or discomfort, especially because something may be wrong or unsafe
definition.zh: 不安；焦虑；担忧（尤其因觉得可能有问题或不安全而产生的情绪）

examples.en: I felt a sense of unease when I heard footsteps behind me.
examples.zh: 听到身后有脚步声时，我感到一阵不安。

examples.en: There was unease in the room after the manager’s sudden announcement.
examples.zh: 经理突然宣布消息后，房间里弥漫着不安的气氛。

examples.en: Her unease grew as the plane hit turbulence.
examples.zh: 飞机遇到气流颠簸时，她的焦虑加剧了。

extraExplanation: “Unease”是名词，常用搭配有：a sense of unease（不安感）、cause/feel unease（引起/感到不安）、unease about/at（对……感到不安）。语气比“fear（恐惧）”更轻，通常是隐隐的担心或不舒服。
相关词对比：uneasy（adj. 不安的），unsettled（更强调“心里没着落/局势不稳定”），anxiety（更强、更持续的焦虑；也可指临床层面的焦虑）。

summary.en: “Uneasily” means in an anxious/uncomfortable way, or (less commonly) in an unsteady way.
summary.zh: “Uneasily”表示“不安/不自在地”，也可表示“（物体）不稳地”。

definition.en: In a nervous, worried, or uncomfortable way; not calmly or confidently.
definition.zh: 不安地；焦虑地；不自在地（不平静、不自信地）。

examples.en: She laughed uneasily and looked away.
examples.zh: 她不自在地笑了笑，把目光移开。

examples.en: He shifted uneasily in his seat during the interview.
examples.zh: 面试时他在座位上不安地挪动。

examples.en: The children listened uneasily to the strange noise outside.
examples.zh: 孩子们不安地听着外面的怪声。

definition.en: Not firmly or steadily; in a way that shows lack of balance or stability.
definition.zh: 不稳地；不平稳地（缺乏平衡或稳定）。

examples.en: The ladder stood uneasily against the wall.
examples.zh: 梯子靠在墙上，立得不太稳。

examples.en: The vase sat uneasily on the narrow shelf.
examples.zh: 花瓶放在狭窄的架子上，看起来不太稳。

extraExplanation: “uneasily”通常与肢体动作或说话方式搭配，暗示人物内心紧张：如 laughed/smiled/shifted uneasily。
它是形容词“uneasy（不安的／不稳的）”加副词后缀“-ly”构成；语气比“nervously”更宽一些，也可表示“尴尬、不自在”。

summary.en: Uneasiness means a mild feeling of worry or discomfort because something feels uncertain or wrong.
summary.zh: Uneasiness 指因不确定或感觉不对劲而产生的（通常较轻微的）不安与不适感。

definition.en: A feeling of discomfort, worry, or anxiety (often mild), especially because something feels uncertain or not quite right.
definition.zh: 不安；心神不宁（通常较轻微），常因事情不确定或感觉不对劲而产生。

examples.en: I felt a growing uneasiness before the interview.
examples.zh: 面试前我感到越来越不安。

examples.en: There was uneasiness in the room when the topic came up.
examples.zh: 这个话题一出现，房间里就有种不安的气氛。

examples.en: Her uneasiness was clear from the way she kept checking her phone.
examples.zh: 她不停看手机的样子明显透露出不安。

extraExplanation: “uneasiness”来自形容词“uneasy”（不安的）+ 名词后缀“-ness”（表示“……的状态/性质”）。因此它强调一种“处于不安状态”的感觉。
语感上，“uneasiness”常用于较含蓄、程度不算特别强的焦虑或担心；比“fear”（恐惧）弱，比“concern”（担忧）更带情绪与身体上的不舒服感。
常见搭配：a sense of uneasiness（不安感）；feel uneasiness（感到不安）；growing uneasiness（逐渐加重的不安）；uneasiness about/over sth（对某事的不安）。

summary.en: Uneasy means not feeling calm or comfortable—worried, tense, or slightly afraid; it can also describe a tense or unstable situation.
summary.zh: Uneasy 指不平静、不自在的感觉（担心、紧张、隐隐害怕），也可形容关系或局势紧张、不稳定。

definition.en: Feeling worried, nervous, or slightly afraid; not calm or comfortable.
definition.zh: 感到担心、紧张或有点害怕；不安、不自在。

examples.en: I felt uneasy walking home alone at night.
examples.zh: 我晚上一个人走回家时感到不安。

examples.en: She grew uneasy when he didn’t reply to her messages.
examples.zh: 他没有回她的信息时，她变得不安起来。

examples.en: There was an uneasy silence in the room after the argument.
examples.zh: 争吵之后，房间里出现了令人不舒服的沉默。

definition.en: Causing discomfort or tension; not pleasant or relaxed.
definition.zh: 让人不舒服或紧绷的；不轻松、不愉快的。

examples.en: The two countries have an uneasy relationship.
examples.zh: 这两个国家的关系并不稳定，令人紧张。

examples.en: He gave an uneasy laugh and changed the subject.
examples.zh: 他尴尬地笑了笑，然后换了话题。

definition.en: Not stable or secure; likely to change or fail.
definition.zh: 不稳定的；不牢靠的；可能会变化或出问题的。

examples.en: They reached an uneasy agreement that could break at any time.
examples.zh: 他们达成了一个随时可能破裂的不稳定协议。

extraExplanation: “uneasy”由前缀 un-（否定）+ easy（轻松的）构成，字面意思是“不轻松”。它常用来形容一种“说不清原因但感觉不对劲”的紧张或担忧。
常见搭配：uneasy feeling（不安的感觉）、uneasy silence（尴尬/令人不舒服的沉默）、uneasy relationship/truce/peace（紧张或不稳定的关系/停战/和平）。
与相近词的区别：nervous更偏“紧张”（如演讲前），anxious更偏“焦虑/担忧”（常与未来结果有关），uneasy更偏“心里不踏实/不自在”。

summary.en: Uneatable means not fit to be eaten because it tastes bad, is spoiled, or is badly cooked.
summary.zh: Uneatable 指“难以下咽/不适合食用”，常因味道差、变质或做坏了。

definition.en: Not fit to be eaten; too unpleasant, spoiled, or badly cooked to eat.
definition.zh: 难以下咽的；不适合食用的（可能因变质、味道差或烹饪失败）。

examples.en: The soup was so salty it was uneatable.
examples.zh: 这汤咸得难以下咽。

examples.en: After sitting in the sun all day, the sandwich became uneatable.
examples.zh: 三明治在太阳下放了一整天，变得不适合吃了。

examples.en: The rice was burnt and uneatable.
examples.zh: 米饭烧焦了，没法吃。

extraExplanation: “Uneatable”由前缀 un-（否定）+ eatable（可食用的）组成，意思很直观。
在日常英语里，更常见的拼写是 “inedible”（不可食用的，偏正式）或 “unappetizing”（看起来/闻起来不诱人，但未必不能吃）。如果你想表达“真的不能吃”，用 inedible 更自然。

summary.en: “Unecological” means harmful to the environment, but it’s less common than “not eco-friendly” or “environmentally unfriendly.”
summary.zh: “unecological”意思是“对环境有害/不环保”，但不如“not eco-friendly / environmentally unfriendly”等表达常用自然。

definition.en: Harmful to the environment; not environmentally friendly.
definition.zh: 对环境有害的；不环保的。

examples.en: Using single-use plastic bags every day is unecological.
examples.zh: 每天使用一次性塑料袋是不环保的。

examples.en: Some cleaning products are unecological because they pollute rivers.
examples.zh: 有些清洁用品不环保，因为它们会污染河流。
